resources.string: Talk to {destinationName}
How is an honest, hardworking merchant to make a living under these wretched conditions?
It’s a disgrace to New Corsica and to our patrons.
The gods prepare to return, stranger! They judge our every deed, word, and thought!
Do not anger them, lest you suffer their divine wrath!
Greetings, pilgrim. The gods once inhabited this holy site. Tread with reverence for they are watching.
Be careful when traveling outside the city. An invasionary force gathers out there!
You have entered a desperate battlefield, stranger! Be ready to defend yourself against the Corrupted!
The Legion's at our door, and the Ancients are rampaging across the sands. Let us drink and laugh while we can!
Welcome to the Thermae, my friend - the finest place to rest in all of Brimstone Sands!
This place holds many dangers for the unwary. Make sure your weapon is at the ready, and keep your wits about you.
There is never enough wine around when you need it. I am simply parched and could do with a cold drink.
Greetings, Seeker. I'm tracking the movements of the 19th Legion. My task, I fear, will never be finished.
My farm was all but destroyed the last time I needed to travel to New Corsica.
I swear, I never know what will happen next when I am away. But I must visit the city for supplies.
I hope you have paid your taxes recently! If you have, you needn't worry about a visit from me, Caeso, Frumen of New Corsica!
You look like a person who lives for excitement. Tell me my intuition is right! Life has been ever so dull around here.
I tell you, Pontifex Charmion even shut down my plays! What is a city without a lively theatre scene?
Good riddance to that harpy Charmion! I'll be happier without her around.
I know, I sound indelicate, but she threatened to behead me if I kept writing plays about her and Crassus. Beheading? Over a few jests!
I've been thinking about writing a new play about you.
The source material is a playwright's dream. Ambition, betrayal, tragedy, triumph… your story has it all!
Here for the arena? Out of luck. Pontifex shut it down. Nothing to do but sit, wait, and drink.
Could go out there and fight the Legion, but fighting for sport's different from fighting for real.
Heard a lot about you adventurers lately. Sounds like a decent living. See places, meet people, fight monsters.
Not sure if I could do it. Lost a lot over the years. Memories, skills, and people.
Arena might open again, with Charmion gone. Don't know if I'll stick around to see it.
Still like the idea of doing what you do. Adventurer Mevia. There's a nice ring to it, don’t you think?
Cacti must be god's idea of a joke. They're too bitter to drink, too spiky to eat, and too tough to uproot.
If you ask me, Sutekh's to blame. He's the sort of god who'd litter the earth with useless, spiny plants.
I've brewed a new drink in honor of Queen Cleopatra's return. And you'll never guess what gives it color and flavor.
Cactus fruit! I've taste-tested every batch, and I guarantee it's a drink worthy of our beloved Queen.
My goodness, so many new arrivals these days. And your clothes are like nothing I've ever seen!
Oh, I know times are tough, but I can't help getting excited. We're long overdue for fresh faces in New Corsica.

string.comment: After Evandrus moves to New Corsica
string.speaker: Elissa
string.name: Elissa

resources.string: Poor Evandrus. He's a brave man, coming back to face his demons.

string.comment: After Evandrus moves to New Corsica
string.speaker: Elissa
string.name: Elissa

resources.string: I offered him a gift of new tunics, but I don't think he feels comfortable out of his armor. It's hard to blame him, after what he's seen.
The Queen ordered some purple gowns for her wardrobe. Oh, what am I to do?
Nothing on this island produces color as rich as Tyrian purple. But I'll find a way. Nothing but the best for Queen Cleopatra.
No escape. No hope. No salvation from the red-eyed devils. T-they were at Shattered Mountain. On the shores. In the voices that howled.
And n-now, here too? I c-can't fight them, not again!
I n-never was much good with a sword. Father was a rancher. M-maybe I could do the same, somewhere far from the f-fighting.
Let me guess. You saw a poor old woman alone in the desert, and thought she needed help hobbling back to town?
Pah! You townsfolk are all the same. I'm quite content here, far from all the noise and trouble.
So you've met the Insatiable Flame. That rascal tore up all my plants when he first showed up.
Then he cowered like a kitten after I gave him a good scolding. He's quite sweet, as long as he's well-fed.
Tamouthis stopped by the other day. Said you put down the scorpion queen and her vile brood. Maybe you're all right for a city-dweller.
The moon and sun were one. Great Kronos peeled back the veil, and I saw the true nature of all things.
There are terrible holes in the world. Should we fall through, we will be devoured whole.
The boy does not know, yet he believes himself wise. I have stepped through the gates and lost my way.
They are not trifles for our convenience or amusement, no! But does he listen to poor, mad Titus? No one does!
You believe yourself victorious. It is but a respite. A moment of calm before the storm.
Ancient gods will blot out the sun. Their arms will cross the horizon and envelop the world in shadow.
The locals speak of a mighty wurm that burrows beneath the dunes. This land of blistering sun and biting wind has horrors aplenty, but so far I've seen no sign of the beast.
If you catch a glimpse of it, let me know. Its head will make a fine addition to my wall.
By God, I was such a fool to come here! A few nights ago, I saw the face of the great wurm.
I fell to my knees and waited for the end. But it passed without taking my life. Why? Why did it spare me?
Finally, someone with the sense to bring their own supplies.
Not that I'd have much to give you if you didn't. We're short of everything useful around here.
I heard about your exploits at the Great Pyramid. The whole camp talks of nothing else.
You can't seem to keep yourself out of trouble, friend. The world-ending, earth-shaking sort of trouble.
You're no soldier. Were we friends, or foes? I… can't recall your face, but I hope you're here to help.
The Legion was supposed to protect people. And we did, long ago.
Evandrus. I remember… the day I told him I was retiring. He smiled at me, the happiest smile I've ever seen.
Now we're both back in armor, fighting, with no more smiles between us.
Is it over? I can go back to my farm, and let this fade into the fog of memory.
Well, I hope I won't forget you. You were kind, brave, and true. Everything I wanted to be as a legionary.
Devastation and ruin as far as the eye can see, and no one to lead us through it.
No matter how fervently we prayed, the gods refused to give us peace and quiet. We'll only find help in each other.
I wondered when Charmion would show her true face. Hmph. The less said about her, the better.
Are the rumors true? Has Queen Cleopatra herself returned to us? Part of me yearns to see her splendor.
But I wasted so many years in New Corsica, under Charmion's thumb. Better to stay here and help where I can.
I've lost two carts, several priceless heirlooms, and my best sandals since leaving New Corsica.
Fortuna is a cruel mistress, but she could always take more from me.
Things seem to be going well, but I think my time in this land is coming to a close. Call it business intuition or wanderlust.
Hmm… I've never been to Ebonscale Reach. That sounds like a good change of scenery.
I hope you haven't come in search of healing. I will do my very best, but I have little to work with.
People on Aeternum are so careless toward their own health. It's frightful to see.

string.comment: If Life Staff Mastery is maxed
string.speaker: Akamatsu Suke
string.name: AkamatsuSuke

resources.string: Someday, I'd like to learn how to use a Life Staff. I thought the locals were exaggerating when they told me about it.

string.comment: If Life Staff Mastery is maxed
string.speaker: Akamatsu Suke
string.name: AkamatsuSuke

resources.string: The power to heal injuries and soothe pain with a wave of your hands… it's like something out of a legend.
Take care of yourself, friend. After all your heroic struggles, I think you've earned a breather.
We may live forever, but we're still human. We need rest and care, and you're no exception.
So many abandoned valuables, so little time. People leave the most incredible things behind.
Oh, judge not lest ye be judged, friend. Besides, I doubt the Lost or Corrupted need their earthly treasures.
With the Legion no longer on the rampage, it's easier than ever to scavenge things.
But I loved the danger, every second of it. There's nothing like the rush of barely escaping with your life. You can relate, right?
Hah! It seems the New Corsicans finally listened to me, and sent another professional to do their killing.
Welcome to this little piece of hell, friend. There's no shortage of danger, and plenty of work for two.
I hear Evandrus is trying to rehabilitate his father's image. Wonder how much of the eulogizing is true.
People are awfully quick to put words in the mouths of the departed, if you catch my drift.
If Cleopatra needs mercenaries, put in a word for me. Things got mighty quiet around here.
Good for everyone else, bad for me. I get bored when the fighting dies down.
Welcome, welcome! Please, there is plenty of room. Have a seat by the fire, or take a rest if you'd like.
You're brave, traveler. Not many come this way by choice.We've bunks in the tent, if you need to rest for a while.
The Ancient Glyphs
William Heron seeks an intrepid adventurer to search for Ancient Glyphs. Collect the glyph at the ruins of Satet, discover its purpose, and return to Heron in New Corsica.
New Corsica, ancient bastion of knowledge and hidden secrets. I find this place suits me, though I wish travel by spirit shrines wasn't so nauseating.
"Discovered anything interesting?"
Ha ha! Around here, one could blindly throw a stone and hit something interesting.
Since you asked, are you eager to help me unravel one of the Ancients' secrets?
"Which secret? They have so many."
Their language. You may have seen glyphs carved into ruins all over this region. I suspect that those glyphs are part of the Ancients' language.
Go see one for yourself. Even knowing the glyph grants mystic power.
Trust me, you'll understand the… oddities of Ancient glyphs better if you find one yourself.
Well? A fascinating experience, wasn't it? Knowing the meaning of the glyph acted as a key for you.
Ha ha! I believe there are twenty-six glyphs in total, though I've only begun my search for them.
"They sound very useful."
To an adventurer like you, I'm sure the glyphs will unlock innumerable doors and hidden secrets.
To a scholar like me, they could reveal more of the Ancients than we've ever known.
How goes your search for the Ancient glyphs?
I've been tracking down local rumors of their locations, but it's tedious work sorting the wheat from the chaff.
Your dedication to knowledge may even come close to my own. And you're much better suited to exploring dangerous locales.
I am in your debt. When I uncover more about the glyphs or the language's secrets, you will be the first to know.
Travel to {POITags} in search of an Ancient Glyph
Use Your Azoth Staff to unseal the Glyph
Read the Ancient Glyph "EYBUE"
Use the Ancient Glyph "EYBUE" to open the sealed chest at Satet
Study the Ancient Glyph "EYBUE" on the chest
This desert air is terrible for my tools, to say nothing of my skin. What I wouldn't give for a proper university workshop.
Scarab Secrets
Eudoxia Dalassema needs someone willing to crack open Anubian Scarab Constructs and mine out the power sources within--preferably without alerting the authorities in New Corsica.
You don't look like a local. I was hoping I might bend your ear for an unusual request.
But nothing illegal, I promise. Let's simply call it... destructive investigation.
"An interesting choice of words."
Then I have your attention? Excellent.
Have you seen the Anubian Scarabs that patrol the ruins outside New Corsica? They glitter beautifully in the sunlight.
"Scarabs? You mean insects?"
Not insects. The scarabs are constructs of the Ancients themselves, and I'm after the secrets of how they were built.
What do you say? I'll have a handsome reward waiting if you mine out the source of their power.
The constructs cluster near Khnum, though I've never understood why. The ruin's naught but crumbling walls. Are they guarding something?
Oh, these devices look like toys! Can something this small give life to an entire construct?
We're like children compared to the Ancients, aren't we? Thank you for indulging my curiosity, and being discreet about it.
"What's THAT supposed to mean?"
Only that you didn't tell the Pontifex about my request. Others can revere the Ancients, but I think imitation is the highest form of flattery.
If we could build constructs and monuments to rival theirs… well, I can dream.
Sulfur, mercury, gypsum glass, but this fourth element eludes me. Some kind of refined Azoth? How does it remain stable?
Ah, it's you! As you can see, the scarab power sources keep me very busy.
Visit the ruins of {POITags} to study Scarab Constructs
Destroy {targetName}
Mine 3 Scarab Cores
Lone Jackal
Slay the jackals of Deadwater Den who attacked Senhyris, and find some medicine to treat her wounds.
W-Who are you?! Stay back, don't come any closer!
Augh… I really hope you aren't a bandit. Though if you are, I don't have much for you to take.
"Are you all right?"
Do I look all right to you? Between the desert and the beasts, I'm lucky I'm even breathing.
Can't say I feel lucky, though. The jackals never used to be this bold. They're hungry and desperate, just like us.
"I can drive them off."
You do that. I'll wait here, useless, and hope the jackals don't come back to finish their meal.
There's a big one who's developed a taste for human flesh. Teach her a lesson, and the others should back off.
Did you lose your nerve? Or maybe you thought better of chasing after jackals.
Is that medicine? You didn't have to do that. Thank you. For driving off the jackals, and saving my sorry skin.
I'm sorry for snapping at you earlier. It WAS lucky you showed up.
"You shouldn't be out here alone."
By the gods. You sound like my parents before they… before...
Anyway, I can make my way back. I'll go straight to camp. No more solo hunts for me.
Before you appeared, I didn't think strangers would show us any kindness. The gods might have abandoned us, but you didn't.
Thanks again, friend. I'll remember you when I'm well enough to hunt again.
Go east to {POITags}, fight the jackals who attacked Senhyris, and find medicine to treat her wounds
Defeat {targetName}
Procure {itemName} to treat Senhyris' wounds
This bag was almost buried by the sands. It contains several small portraits on wood, a half-full waterskin, and a brittle note.
The note is almost illlegible , though you can make out a few lines toward the end.
"Damn your stubbornness, Gaius. I don't care how far you have to march. Just get out of New Corsica!"
Wh-what are you? Bandit? Phantom? Hungry specter? Mercy, mercy, I beg of you!
Oh dread Pluto, please don't take me yet! I have so much to live for!
W-who's asking? How do I know you're not some unscrupulous ruffian?
Oh, I never should've left New Corsica! Charmion's sermons were tiresome, but at least I had a warm bed!
My belongings? You're not a bandit?
Ah. Please forgive my outburst, that was unbecoming for a man of my station. I'll just be on my way.
Oh, mighty Jupiter, have mercy on me!
You saved my life, and I was too flustered to thank you properly. Please accept my humblest apologies.
I don’t know what you' re seeking, but I hope Fortuna is kinder to you than she was to me.
Ruffled Feathers
Nesse van Baten wants revenge on "Featherbane" the lion, who has developed an unfortunate taste for domestic poultry. Go to Two-Stones Grotto, then meet back up with Nesse at the nearby Outpost.
Naught left but feathers and blood. At this rate I'll be ruined, though we'll all starve first. Now there's a cheery thought.
What are you looking at? A woman at her wits' end, that's what.
"Calm down, I'm here to help."
Help? Hah! That would be a first in this godforsaken wasteland.
But you don't look as helpless as everyone else fleeing New Corsica. Tell me, how do you feel about lions?
"Depends on what you have in mind."
Slaughter. One of those thrice-damned cats has been picking off my birds one by one.
Nothing will bring my birds back, but you could put an end to Featherbane and help me sleep better at night.
I didn't name the lion "Featherbane." One of the other refugees thought it was funny.
Featherbane is gone? That's the first good news I've heard in weeks!
That wretched cat took everything from me. Turkeys, pheasants, even the peacocks!
"What will you do now?"
Try not to think about this disaster. I thought New Corsica would be a wonderful business opportunity.
Now look at me. I wonder if anybody around here makes a good, strong brew.
I'll say this for the New Corsicans. They're a hardy lot. Despite the Legion and the wild beasts, the camp's held together.
Perhaps I'll stay a while longer, at least until I get back on my feet.
Travel southeast to {POITags} and find Featherbane the Lion
Slay Featherbane for Nesse
What a fine mess. I'll be lucky if I ever find him. Oh, why did that storm have to strike now?
Aggressive Negotiations
Huang Xiaoling is looking for a man who may have shipwrecked on the southern coast of Brimstone Sands. Search for any survivors at The Offering, then meet up with Xiaoling at Cavalier's Rest.
I'm sorry to trouble you, but did you see a man wash up on the southern shore?
I was awaiting his arrival, but then his ship crashed during the storm. I saw it all happen!
"You watched a shipwreck?"
Yes, I watched from safety. What was I to do, wade out into the waves and battle them myself?
I think the worst of the storm has passed. So if you're headed toward the shoreline, could you see if anyone survived?
"Yes, but I make no promises."
Aeternum's storms are cruel, it's true. The man you're looking for is Ambassador Li, from Ebonscale Reach.
If you do find him, I'll be at Cavalier's Rest. Please let me know how he fares!
What possessed the Ambassador to keep sailing through such a terrible storm?
It's you. And since you are unscathed and uncorrupted, I assume you found Ambassador Li? Or he did not make it ashore?
"He did. And he tried to kill me!"
I'm sure you held your own admirably.
Li has been a thorn in my side for months, trying to make contact with other Corrupted on behalf of the Empress. A swift, violent demise should set him back nicely.
"You could've told me the truth."
In my experience, most people balk at being asked to assassinate someone.
Peace, friend. I always intended to compensate you for your efforts. And for the future, I'll remember that you prefer ugly truths to pretty words.
You'll be glad to hear that no more of the Empress's ships have sailed this way.
I would dearly love to return home. But this Corrupted Legion... they worry me.
Travel to {POITags} in search of Ambassador Li
Defeat the Corrupted Ambassador Li
Meet Xiaoling at {POITags}
These rough conditions are utterly beneath me. Do you know who I am?
Froderico Renaldi, renowned scholar of the classics! You may know me from my treatise about Marius's reforms.
Broken Pedestals
Froderico Renaldi is beside himself after being murdered just outside Castrum Inferos. Recover the unfortunate historian's belongings from the Castrum, and return them to him.
They killed me! How dare they! Stabbed me through and tossed me over the palisade like a rag doll! Oh, the indignity of it all…
"The Legion did this to you?"
I sent a letter to their camp, announcing my intentions to survey their buildings for posterity.
But when I approached, the brutes started hurling pila at me! I woke up here covered in blood, with only the clothes on my back.
"You do know they're Corrupted?"
Tch. You must understand, to an educated historian like me, the Corruption sounds quite ridiculous.
Alas, now I've lost all my notes for my trouble. If your travels take you to the nearby Castrum, I would pay well for their return.
If Caesar, Augustus, and Antony could see how far their Roman brethren had fallen… Would they weep at this degeneracy?
My notes! Grazie mille, friend. That's my life's work… though it may need some revision.
When I was a student, the Romans of old seemed godlike. Titans whose reach spanned the known world.
"And now that you've met them?"
I would not judge all Romans by those few who are Corrupted. But it's hard to forget the feeling of iron spearheads sinking into my chest.
Perhaps a change of academic interest would be best for me.
Oh. I began working on a new book, about textiles and evolving fashion among the Roman exiles.
It may be a less prestigious topic, but looms are less likely to stab me to death.
Search {POITags} for Froderico Renaldi's research notes
Defeat Legion Sagittarii
Search chests or fallen Sagittarii for Froderico's notes
The Ancients must have been giants compared to us.
Look at the size of these steps, the monumental perfection of each stone block! One can only wonder at the secrets they contain.
An Ancient Balancing Act
Perrin Mercier discovered a tantalizing mystery in the collapsed Roman aqueduct, but can't climb it himself. Brave the treacherous ascent into the aqueduct, then return to Perrin with your findings.
I'll have a limp for weeks. Monsieur Heron makes scrambling up and down ancient ruins sound so easy!
Oh, I beg your pardon. I'm just recovering from an embarrassing fall.
"Are you hurt?"
Ah. Mostly my ego bruised. Have you read the writings of William Heron? His words inspired me to be an antiquarian.
So naturally, I set out to climb the ruined aqueduct as soon as I arrived.
"… Naturally."
It's harder than it looks! Though maybe not for someone like you?
I know it sounds absurd, but I saw glimmers of light shining through the stones. I would love to know what they are!
Be careful, friend. I thought the aqueduct looked easy to climb, and I paid for my hubris.
You really did it? Climbed the aqueduct and came back in one piece? The last mercenary who passed through just scoffed at me.
What did you find? Ancient tomb guardians? Mysterious artifacts? Hidden treasure?
"An Ancient glyph."
Even better! I know Monsieur Heron had an interest in those.
I admit, I feel a twinge of envy at your prowess. Still, I must thank you for sating my curiosity.
Access the Aqueduct at {POITags} to search for hidden secrets
Traverse the Top of the Aqueduct to the Oasis
Use Your Azoth Staff to unseal the Glyph
Read the Ancient Glyph "WETZUU"
The Antiquarian's Dream

Emboldened by your success at the aqueduct, Perrin seeks your help to unlock the function of an Ancient stone gateway. Look for clues in the ruins of Hermopolis, then return to Perrin at the Great Shrine of Thoth.
Have you seen the circular stone gates at Hermopolis? There is one just like them, right above our heads.
But no matter what I do, the gateway here remains inactive.
"Maybe you're missing something."
That could be. I've never had the chance to compare the different gateways.
The road from here to Hermopolis is long, and full of scorpions.
"I'll take a look if I visit."
You will? Then I won't be idle in your absence. These Ancient devices WILL yield their secrets to us.
Oh please, let me know as soon as you've visited Hermopolis.
You… what did you do? How did you accomplish that?! I found the very same glyph, but I never produced even a flicker of magic!
"I went on a journey."
Then knowing the meaning of the glyph is insufficient to give it power. One must understand and embody the concept, whatever it is.
Argh. So that's why my attempts were inadequate.
"Don't be so down on yourself."
But I'm… no, no, you're right. I mustn't give up on my dreams, even with all my missteps.
Thank you. Someday, I'll be a respected antiquarian in my own right, and I hope you'll be there to see it.
Travel south to {POITags} and search for any clues about unlocking the teleporter gates
Read the first note
Read the second note
Read the third note
Return to {POITags} and attempt to unlock the teleporter gateway located on the top level
Use Your Azoth Staff to unseal the Glyph at the Great Shrine
Read the Ancient Glyph "TEYII"
Unlock the teleporter gate at the Great Shrine of Thoth
Do you think Monsieur Heron would be interested in collaborating with me?
My knowledge of languages pales next to his. I should brush up on my Latin, but I've never found book learning easy.
Will she ever forgive me? Her Excellency isn't known for her charitable nature, but this humble servant can hope for her favor.
I am unworthy! I have doomed Her Excellency, that gentle soul entrusted to my care.
There is no warmth in the sun, and no more joy in life.
Lady Flora, the light of my life and apple of my eye! She was taken from me by wild beasts, and only I escaped.
I'll never forget the way she looked at me, hurt and betrayal welling in her limpid, black eyes…
Even if you do bring her back, she will castigate my cowardice. But I will endure it to be in her presence again.
The beasts live in the valley west of here. If you can punish them for abducting Flora, all the better.
You, there. Yes, YOU, human with the slack-jawed face. I hope you can hear me.
I do not enjoy shrieking into the void, and it's high time that fool Aulus sent someone to fetch me.
How impertinent! I have never been more affronted in my life! You will address me correctly as Lady Flora, Her Excellency.
Now, convey me back to my servant, and I will see you richly rewarded.
Her Excellency is returned to me! Behold her twitching nose, her noble banded scales, and her delightful little tail. Ah.
Thank you, brave friend, a thousand thanks and blessings!
Hm? Her Excellency requires no common, crass speech to make her exalted wishes known.
A talking armadillo, what a ludicrous idea! Are you quite well? Did the lions take a swipe at your head?
All forgotten, all forgiven. It is clear that you have also been chosen to serve Lady Flora and her noble relatives.
And should you need advice on the care and pampering of armadillos, you know where to find me.
Have you given a name to your own armadillo? Flora the Second has a pleasant ring to it.
Then again, Her Excellency may prefer to be the only Flora. You should pick a different name.
(The armadillo gives you a single, disdainful sniff before looking away.)
I happened to be eavesdropping. For your information, I have never spoken to Aulus as I speak to you.
His poor, tiny mind couldn't handle the shock! At least yours is made of sterner stuff.
We have strayed from the ways of our ancestors. And in return, the curse of the Lost is ours to bear.
Coming Forth by Day

Acolyte Miresis seeks Egyptian funerary rites from his former mentor Psherenamun, who has become Lost. Seek out Psherenamun at Castrum Perdita, take the texts from him, and return to Saboteur's Hideaway.
Memory fades with each passing year, and none remember the old rituals.
I wouldn't expect such things to matter to an outsider. But to those who try to honor the gods, it is of profound importance.
"Try me. I'm listening."
Before we came to Aeternum, my people performed nearly two hundred incantations for the dead. But the practice faded long ago.
Psherenamun, my mentor, tried to reconstruct the old rites to save people from becoming Lost.
"Is that even possible?"
We thought so. We performed the rite for a young man who was recently Lost. When it failed…
The dead man broke his bindings and snapped Psherenamun's neck. Now my mentor wanders with the Lost.
"I'm so sorry."
Not as sorry as I am. But if you could retrieve the book of funerary rites from Psherenamun, I would be forever in your debt.
I haven't given up on saving him, or the other Lost. Not yet.
Where did we go wrong? Was it the incantations? The images? The mystical names of the judges?
You return! And you seem sound of mind and body. But what of Psherenamun? Was he still…?
"I didn't see him, but I found this."
...We must have committed some great transgression, to have the afterlife denied to us.
Thank you for returning the texts. Now please, leave me. My mind is ill at ease.
What incantation do I try next? To whom do I pray? Someone must hear our prayers. If not… no, I dare not entertain the thought.
Travel west to {POITags}
Search for Psherenamun among the Lost
Collect the scroll of funerary rites
The Insatiable Flame
Bring delicious fish to the Insatiable Flame before he decides to make a snack out of you. You can catch fresh fish from any fishing hotspot in Brimstone Sands.
Hrrm? A delicious passing morsel? No, you look rather too large and uncomfortable to eat.
Why do you stare? Do you WANT to be my dinner?
"I'd rather not be eaten."
And I'd rather not go hungry! So what do you mean to do about it, human?
Quickly now, my temper is short when my belly rumbles. I’m sure you know the feeling.
"I could find you some dinner?"
Fish! Fresh, not too oily, from the sea if you can find it. But lake fish will do if you can't.
Mmm… You may catch some fish for yourself, but no thieving from my share. I'll know if you do.
Fish? No? Then begone.
Mrr, the delectable aroma of fish. This is much better than eating you.
You're still staring. I promise, my belly is full, and you are in no danger of being eaten.
"It's just… you're a talking lion."
So I am. This form suits me. It's powerful yet comfortable, and I can sample the delights of fish.
Much more enjoyable than being a disembodied spirit of flame who torments your kind. Now begone, I'm overdue for a good, long nap.
A human? Ah, my favorite human, the bringer of fish. May your sunbeams be warm, your catches plentiful, and your belly full.
Catch an Extra-Tasty Fish in Brimstone Sands
Bring the Extra-Tasty Fish to the Insatiable Flame
According to this map, the ruin's a bit further up the cliff. Oh, I should've asked for directions before wandering out here.
Artistic License
Enez de Barros is convinced that there are dragon eggs at the Palace of Nekhbet. Search the reptile nests for eggs of any sort, and bring them back for Enez's inspection.
Ah, a fellow traveler! This may strike you as an odd question, but have you ever seen a dragon on this mountainside?
To be clear, I speak of the variety with large wings and flaming breath.
"Can't say I have."
That's a shame. As a little girl, I loved stories of dragons, and I was hoping to find some for creative inspiration.
Supposedly, many dragons nest in that ruin up the road.
"Pretty sure they aren't real dragons."
Oh. Don't give up so easily! I'm not asking you to SLAY a dragon or anything.
Just see if there are dragons, and if they have any eggs. A dragon's egg would be marvelous inspiration for my next sculpture.
My father used to read me the story of Saint George, and I always felt sorry for the dragon.
Hmm, just by looking at your face, I can see there were no dragons awaiting you. Ah, well. Perhaps they hide elsewhere on Aeternum.
"I did find some eggshells."
Oh. What a fine color, and excellent luster. With a little imagination, this will make a perfect dragon's egg.
What? Haven't you heard of artistic liberty? Add plaster and paint, and there it is. A dragon's egg!
Thanks to you, I'm overflowing with ideas for my sculptures. Why stop at dragon eggs?
The well-to-do of Aeternum may want a unicorn horn, or a manticore stinger to hang over their fireplaces.
Travel southwest to {POITags}
Loot 3 nests for "dragon" eggs
I can't help watching the Great Pyramid out of the corner of my eye. Do you know what holds it aloft? Neither do I. I don't like the thought one bit.
Path of the Devourer
Lysandra is distressed by strange tremors that have recently rocked the Great Pyramid of Akhet. Survey the area around the pyramid's base, and find evidence of what is causing the tremors.
Another mercenary. The deserts have been lousy with you lot. Pick up a survey map and make yourself useful. How's your hearing?
"Good enough, I think. Why?"
See the pyramid? Quiet for eons, but tremors started beneath its base a few weeks ago.
The shaking turns the sand beneath your feet into a death trap.
"That sounds unnerving."
The Ancients keep their treasures well-guarded. Why shouldn't they shake the ground out from under us?
I'll gladly pay you to find the causes of these tremors. If the earth is going to swallow me up, I'd like to know why.
If you see something bigger than you, run. If it's bigger and faster, hide.
And if you wake up more of those guardians, for God's sake, don't drag them back to camp with you!
Don't take this the wrong way, friend, but you look like you've seen terrible things. I'm not going to like what you found, am I?
"Probably not. I found some spines."
What… are these? Did something SHED these?
I don't think there's anything we could do about a creature of that size. Except perhaps pray that it passes us by.
The tremors continue, but I've yet to see the creature emerge above ground.
A few other travelers mentioned sightings, but I told them to keep their distance.
Search the Pyramid's west side for clues
I've had it with my family! My mother, my uncles, the whole decrepit lot of them.
Must I throw myself over the cliffs to make them see sense? Will anything put a stop to their tiresome meddling?
It would take all day to list out their offenses!
Your pardon, though. My temper's short of late, and that's no reason to snap at passersby. Call it the impatience of a lovesick heart.
I only wish to share a private dinner with my dear Margarete. That's hardly extreme.
But my family can't abide me "taking up" with someone who isn't from the old patrician class. As if THAT matters on an island where we live forever or go mad.
You're serious? Well, you're peculiar, but I won't say no.
Margarete loves flowers, and she has an insatiable sweet tooth. When you've set everything up, find Margarete and tell her I sent you.
The first time I saw her, she was like a breath of fresh air in a mausoleum.
My Margarete deserves better than my wretched family hounding us.
Have we met before? Why are you looking at me so intently?
I haven't been in New Corsica very long, but surely I don't stand out that much.
Huh? Did she sneak out of her villa again? She's been doing that to see me without her family's permission.
I keep telling her I don't want her to get in trouble, but… Lavinia's insistant. And quite irresistable.
Really? She talked about asking someone to help us, but I never dreamed she'd really do it.
Thank you, thank you! May you be as blessed in love as we are.
We should just throw caution to the winds and elope. We wouldn't be the only ones leaving New Corsica.
And the look on my uncle's face as we flee into the sunset… oh, it would be priceless!
You're also new to this place, aren't you?
The monuments and statues are impressive, but I'll never forget the first time I saw a Greek play. I laughed until my sides ached!
You've emboldened Lavinia, friend. Now she's talking of eloping with me! Hah!
She's lived here for centuries, and she's just going to leave it all behind? I'm nervous, but I think she really means it.
Please don't disturb an old man's peaceful retirement.I believe I've earned some quiet.
Sharp eyes, well-worn clothes, and heavy bags. You have the look of a seasoned traveler.
If you'll indulge an old man's curiosity, what brings you to this troubled land?
Well, it's certainly fortuitous for me, for I find myself in some trouble. Thoughtless hunters placed traps in the canyon for my friends.
These old hands aren't what they used to be. Could you disarm those traps, so my friends may roam freely again?
Hmph. Indeed. I dedicated many years to the god Sobek, and in return, the crocodiles treated me with respect and friendship.
Descending into the canyon is harder for me now, but I do my best to look out for my friends' interests.
The crocodiles will not recognize you, and some may be wary. I ask that you do not hurt them.
Back already? And there's no stench of blood on you. You have quick hands and a kind heart.
Thank you for your consideration toward my friends. Few would think much of slaying a crocodile.
Mind your step, traveler. The little scorpions are easy to skewer, but the big ones get the better of many overconfident hunters.
The Queen's Brood (Elite)
The naturalist Tamouthis is concerned by the sudden and unnatural proliferation of massive scorpions in the Bubasteum. Venture into the Beds of Ta-Bitjet and slay the scorpion queen who lives there.
I've heard the most fantastic rumors about you. So, you should have no trouble with a large swarm of angry scorpions.
"How large and how angry, exactly?"
You're cautious. Good to see that fame and glory haven't gone to your head.
A massive scorpion queen made her home in a cave complex to the south. I've been watching her brood for a few seasons.
"What's special about her?"
Not only her size, but also the unnatural ferocity of her brood. If they spread further, they'll wreak havoc.
Make your way into the brood lair and destroy some of their eggs. And if you can, slay the queen.
Hmm… I don't know what's behind the brood's unnatural behavior, but for now, exterminating them is all that matters.
I can smell the scorpion ichor from here. Was it a good hunt? Did you learn why these scorpions were so ferocious?
"It's built among Ancient devices."
The Ancients left many marvelous and horrifying things behind. It's not the first time I've seen transformations among such creatures…
The creatures of the wilds are not to be feared, but understood. That lesson's lost on most, but not you. It's nice to meet a kindred spirit.
Enter the Beds of Ta-Bitjet, clear out egg clutches, and defeat the Scorpion Queen
Destroy Putrid Egg Clutches
Destroy Scorplings
Defeat {targetName}
Those pillars look much taller up close.
Well, they aren't getting any shorter by staring at them. I hope these old legs will carry me the rest of the way.
Damn my aching bones, and damn those goats!
Look at them, bleating down at the world below. It's as though they're taunting me! How did they even get up there?
Oh, we found ourselves a clever one. Well then, clever stranger, how do you feel about jumping up there after them? Hmm…
I'd like some meat from the biggest, baddest goat for my stew.
Mmm. The finest fesenjan you've ever had. It's my grandmother's recipe, a little piece of home.
She always made hers with lamb, but the closest I can find around here are these jumping goats.
Huh? Can it be? Did you really manage to catch that huge goat?
Ahh. Oh, you're a marvel, my friend! I'll make sure you get the first bowl of fesenjan.
Of course! The more good food in the world, the better.
Mind you, this isn't quite what my grandmother made. I've had to get a little creative. I'll call it… Brimstone Fesenjan.
I've been talking to some of the Romans. Did you know they make a sweet omelette with honey and pepper?
Sweet, peppery eggs sound odd, but that's the beauty of food. We all have our own tastes.
Phew, finally got away from all those guardians.
But now what? I can't leave until my mission's complete, but I can't fight through the Ancient guardians either…
Secrets of the Heartgem

<font color="#b2aea1">HEARTRUNE UNLOCK QUEST</font>\nThe Soulwardens sent Anna Rózsa to learn about an intriguing source of power in Brimstone Sands. Unlock your Heartgem's hidden potential at the Great Wall of Nebet-Het, then meet Scout Rózsa at the Palace of Nekhbet.
A fellow Soulwarden out here? Well, I won't look a gift horse in the mouth.
Care to help our brethren one more time? Don't worry, this is a blessing for us… I hope.
"I'm listening."
You may have heard the rumors, but a Soulwarden's Heartgem can grant additional powers through the etching of specific runes.
I'm looking for a way to unlock that power, and Brimstone Sands seemed like a good place to start.
"Seemed? Did something go wrong?"
Yes. The most promising site is the Wall of Nebet-het, but it's crawling with guardians.
I'm overmatched, I admit. But you… you could get inside. Look for anything that reacts to your Heartgem.
Sorry I couldn't tell you more about the Wall. You'll know it when you see it.
You're back! What a relief. I wouldn't know what to say to the other Soulwardens if something happened to our hero.
And there's something different about you. You're still you, but with a sharper edge.
"I found this glyph."
Really? This bizarre shape unlocked your Heartgem? Every time I think the Ancients can't get stranger…
Anyway, I'll send a missive back to the other Soulwardens. Thank you, for salvaging my mission.
I thought the ruins in Everfall were impressive, but that was before I laid eyes on the Wall.
I'll bet that it hides even more secrets. Try going back from time to time, and see if anything else opens up for you.
Travel north to {POITags}
Use Your Azoth Staff to unseal the Ancient Glyph
Read the Ancient Glyph "TSADZUI"
Seek out the entrance to the Wall
Explore the {POITags}
Climb the rubble to reach the top of the Wall
Ascend to the highest point of the Wall
Use the new knowledge to pass through the sealed door
Activate the Platform
Place your Heartgem on the Scales and be judged
Reclaim your Empowered Heartgem
The Gods' Demand
The priest Paubastis needs you to venture near the temple ruins of Henkhisesui, slay a lion, and bring back its heart. He promises good payment but refuses to explain why.
You are far from civilization, stranger. Indulge me in an odd question: how adept are you at handling great beasts of the desert?
"Depends on how hungry they are."
A reasonable answer. You know that this land has faced harsh trials lately.
I seek the gods' assistance in meeting those challenges. But to do that, I need someone with different skills from my own.
"You're being very circumspect."
I would not expect an outsider to understand, and I'm only asking for a simple task.
The nearby temples are home to many great lions. Find one, carve out its heart, and bring it back to me.
Surely someone like you is accustomed to slaying large wildlife?
You're back with the heart? I have some coin for you. Our business is concluded, and you can be on your way.
"What was this heart for?"
If you insist. In peaceful times, simple sacrifices will do. But our times are far from peaceful, and greater aid calls for greater sacrifice.
A lion is a truly extraordinary gift. I hope its heart is enough to assuage the gods.
You again? The sacrifice has been accepted, and we can only pray that the gods stay their wrath. Go, now. I have no more coin or treasure for you.
Travel southeast to {POITags}
Slay a {targetName}
Use your Skinning Knife to remove the heart
This small, weathered statue appears unremarkable.
(The jackal's piercing eyes look you over from head to toe.)
It's hard to make out the writing on this ancient tablet. You can only pick out three words: Ennead, pilgrimage, power.
You undertook the ancient pilgrimage of the gods? You, an outsider, were honored with their blessings?
Huh, I never thought I'd see the day. Many wrote of the Path of the Ennead, but few walked it.
Understand something, seeker. Words of faith are easy to speak, but actions of faith are too burdensome for most.
Your determination--some might say stubbornness--is the exception, not the rule.
Jabir ibn Hayyan posits a balance of sulfur and mercury, but the potency of local sulfur overwhelms mercury and disrupts the normal methods of transmutation.
What a delightful little puzzle!
Huh. Jabir ibn Hayyan posits a balance of sulfur and mercury, but the potency of local sulfur overwhelms mercury and disrupts normal methods of transmutation.
Oh, I'm sorry. I promise, I don't usually talk to myself along the roadside.
Well, since you asked, I'll try to explain.
The philosophers tell us that all metals should be composed of mercury and sulfur, with other metals derived by particular ratios. But the sulfur pools-- oh, I've lost you already.
Yes! Sulfur from the pools has unusual alchemical properties. I won't trouble you with the details.
I'm studying samples, but it's slow going by myself. If you can take sulfur samples during your travels, I'd love to share my findings with you!
You can find sulfur pools all over the desert, but nowhere else on the island.
You remembered the sulfur, and you even took care to wrap up each sample!
This should be more than enough to test Brimstone sulfur against a variety of other metals.
I confess, I'm more interested in the theory. I think this type of sulfur should facilitate the arcane flow of--
I mean, it should allow more potent enchantments. If you try it yourself, let me know.
I thought about using Brimstone sulfur to refine potions. But there's always the issue of drinking the resulting potion.
I've had exactly one serious mishap, and I'm not eager to repeat it.
All these excavations, and for what? For all our efforts at enlightenment, we seem to reap nothing but dust.
Others were supposed to meet us at this encampment. Surveyors and laborers, but no one else has arrived.
Yet sometimes, when the moon is high, I can hear distant voices on the wind. Wailing for help.
I don't know. The sound came from the west, but I can't abandon my post to seek them out.
You're a warrior. Do you ever get the feeling that death haunts your steps? That's how I've felt ever since setting foot here.
The wailing voices came from the west. I'm sorry I don't have more for you than that.
But I've never seen you before… oh no. The thing you spoke to wasn't me. A face-stealer prowls these sands!
It mimics humans, and lures the unsuspecting into the desert where it devours them. I barely held it off when it turned on me.
Yes. No doubt it's close by, waiting to make a meal of you.
I'm sorry, but I'm in no shape to fight it again. Flee if you wish, but if you can put an end to that creature, I'll sleep better at night.
Ahh! Oh, it's you. Please don't sneak up on me like that. Not after what happened with the face-stealer.
I never properly thanked you for saving my life, or slaying that monster.
I'm… in one piece. I can only imagine what must have happened to the missing surveyors.
I should feel fortunate, but I don't. Though the fiend is gone, I doubt I'll ever forget it.
Maybe I should spend some time at the baths, for my health.
I've been jumping at shadows since the… since that incident. Nobody needs a nervous guard.
Welcome to New Corsica, stranger. I apologize for the state of our city but we live in troubled times.

string.comment: Treat as Topic Prompt attached to Severan's default greet
string.speaker: UI - Player Prompt

resources.string: “What’s happened?”

string.comment: Treat as Topic Response attached to Severan's default greet
string.speaker: Barnabas Severan
string.name: BarnabasSeveran

resources.string: An old enemy has returned and amasses his forces. The citizens have fled, fearing invasion is imminent.

string.comment: Treat as Topic Response attached to Severan's default greet
string.speaker: Barnabas Severan
string.name: BarnabasSeveran

resources.string: Now the Praetorians keep order in our streets and on our roads, but their skirmishes with these foes have depleted their ranks.
Hearken to me, traveler! These roads are dangerous. Be on your guard!
The Missing Praetorians
Captain Andrea Clermont has asked you to find her fellow Praetorians. If they've become Lost, help them find peace and bring back proof of their defeat.

string.comment: New Clermont conversation state to start The Missing Praetorians
string.speaker: Andrea Clermont
string.name: AndreaClermont

resources.string: Praise the gods! I’ve been desperate to send word to New Corsica.

string.comment: New Clermont conversation state to start The Missing Praetorians
string.speaker: Andrea Clermont
string.name: AndreaClermont

resources.string: The Praetorians assigned to this camp are missing, and I couldn't abandon this post.
"Why were Praetorians out here?"

string.comment: New proposal state for The Missing Praetorians (repurposed existing recorded dialogue)
string.speaker: Andrea Clermont
string.name: AndreaClermont

resources.string: These Praetorians were to guard the roads so citizens could evacuate the city. We'd received troubling reports of bandits so I was dispatched to check on their status.

string.comment: New proposal state for The Missing Praetorians (repurposed existing recorded dialogue)
string.speaker: Andrea Clermont
string.name: AndreaClermont

resources.string: I found their camp abandoned and no sign of any of them.
“Could they have deserted?”

string.comment: New prompt_next state for The Missing Praetorians (repurposed existing recorded dialogue)
string.speaker: Andrea Clermont
string.name: AndreaClermont

resources.string: Praetorians of New Corsica? Never!

string.comment: New prompt_next state for The Missing Praetorians (repurposed existing recorded dialogue)
string.speaker: Andrea Clermont
string.name: AndreaClermont

resources.string: But our enemies have left hordes of Lost in their wake. I fear my Praetorians may have joined their soulless ranks.
“I can try and find them.”

string.comment: New prompt_next2 state for The Missing Praetorians (repurposed existing recorded dialogue)
string.speaker: Andrea Clermont
string.name: AndreaClermont

resources.string: A most noble offer, friend. Normally I would never accept such help from a non-Praetorian.

string.comment: New prompt_next2 state for The Missing Praetorians (repurposed existing recorded dialogue)
string.speaker: Andrea Clermont
string.name: AndreaClermont

resources.string: If you find them and they've become Lost, I implore you to put them to rest and return their insignias to me.
Those missing Praetorians were my responsibility. I'm ultimately to blame for their fates.
So my suspicions were correct? I prayed it would be otherwise. Those Praetorians were brave soldiers… and good friends.
But you have brought me only three insignias. Emiliano’s insignia is missing.
“Emiliano?”
I meant Praetorian Malatesta. He was their leader, the most capable of their number, and exceedingly clever.
I can’t imagine he would’ve deserted his comrades. Perhaps he’s still alive.
Defeat {targetName} and collect her Insignia.
Defeat {targetName} and collect his Insignia.
Travel to {POITags} and search for the missing Praetorians
Personal Demons
Discover if Praetorian Malatesta still lives. If he has become Lost, defeat him and retrieve his insignia
Malatesta joined the Praetorians a few years ago. There were some problems at first and he almost mustered out.
Eventually, he overcame his personal demons and rose quickly through the ranks.
“What kind of demons?”
He had a... regrettable past. I can't speak further without betraying his confidence. What’s important now is that we discover his fate.
He was... dear to me. Forgive me, it’s not fitting for a Praetorian to show such emotion.
“The heart wants what it wants.”
You speak from experience? Then you understand.
Please discover if Malatesta still lives. If he’s like the others, then I beg you to grant him final peace.
Please, I must know the fate of Praetorian Malatesta. It's important to me.
A letter from Emiliano? He was... robbing the evacuating citizens?
Oh, Emiliano, you struggled so hard to do what was right. I was certain you were a changed man...
“It seems his personal demons won.”
Yes, and it cost the lives of his comrades. I am grateful for all of your help. If only Jupiter would send me fifty more like you.
Search for Praetorian Malatesta in the ruins of {POITags}
Discover the fate of Praetorian Malatesta in the ruins of {POITags}
Defeat Praetorian Malatesta and Collect his Insignia.
Recover "Malatesta's Letter"
Duties Maintained
Take Captain Clermont’s reports back to Prefect Severan in New Corsica.
Prefect Severan must be informed of the situation here. The roads are more perilous than ever. I wish I had better news.
“Do you plan to remain here?”
The roads must be guarded, no matter the circumstances or the cost. That was Praetorian Malatesta’s mission. And now it’s mine.
The Prefect will send reinforcements when he can. Oh, will you take these reports back to him?
“I’ll see that he receives them.”
My thanks. I hate to impose on you further. You’ve already done so much.
And, by the way, I'd appreciate you keeping what you learned about Emiliano between us.
I pray the Prefect is able to find recruits for the Praetorian Guard. We are in desperate need.
Praise Jupiter! Captain Clermont still lives! Her loss would’ve been a great blow to New Corsica.
"Here are her reports."

string.comment: Edited line to deal with minor continuity snarl: Clermont asks the player not to mention Malatesta, and the player has no good reason to betray her confidence, but Severan comments on him anyway.
string.speaker: Barnabas Severan
string.name: BarnabasSeveran

resources.string: I warned her about Malatesta. I never understood what she saw in that scoundrel.

string.comment: Edited line to deal with minor continuity snarl: Clermont asks the player not to mention Malatesta, and the player has no good reason to betray her confidence, but Severan comments on him anyway.
string.speaker: Barnabas Severan
string.name: BarnabasSeveran

resources.string: You have done a great service for the city and we humbly thank you.
“Will New Corsica be all right?"

string.comment: New next2, rewriting some of Severan's old dialogue
string.speaker: Barnabas Severan
string.name: BarnabasSeveran

resources.string: The Praetorians who remain are spread very thin, but I will send reinforcements to Captain Clermont when I can.

string.comment: New next2, rewriting some of Severan's old dialogue
string.speaker: Barnabas Severan
string.name: BarnabasSeveran

resources.string: I'm glad you found her. I sent her to check on the status of the city's evacuation days ago, and had no word from her until now.
Word of your remarkable deeds is spreading, noble warrior. New Corsica salutes you!
The defense of our roads will continue. Oh, should you encounter any Corrupted or Lost on the roads, I’d appreciate you eliminating the threat.
Take Captain Clermont’s reports back to Prefect Severan in New Corsica.
Roar of the Manticore
Inside the Acropolis, investigate the threats that plague the trade route.
Look at this wreckage! It’s a disgrace! Where are the blasted Praetorians?
New Corsica’s already battered reputation may not survive this latest calamity!
“What's going on?”
This caravan was due to deliver vital supplies from New Corsica to the outpost near The Acropolis.
I found it like this! Everyone dead, save for one poor, deranged peddler. He said it was a manticore!
“A manticore? Really?”
Do not dismiss my words! The wretch was dying of thirst and exuded a nauseatingly pungent odor, but he was certain.
He looked into my eyes and whispered the horrid tale. The hellish stinger, the demonic roar. It was a manticore!
“This I have to see for myself.”
If you are so brave as to risk traveling into the monster's den to meet your doom, I won't stop you!
Rather, I will pray to the gods that the manticore does not devour your soul.
Have you had a change of heart? I can't blame you.
Although someone will have to deal with that monster or New Corsica’s trade will be ruined.
Jupiter's balls! Look at the size of that stinger! Oh, see! I told you he was telling the truth! Tell me, what did the beast look like?
“It was just a giant scorpion.”
Preposterous! I heard its monstrous roar echoing on the dunes.
Oh, wait, wait, perhaps the wily beast could shift forms? In any case, I’ll speak to Prefect Severan and request Praetorians be sent to patrol this road.
Well, I still insist that monster was a manticore! And you singlehandedly destroyed it!
Why, your legend will outshine even that of noble Evandrus!
Travel to {POITags} and investigate the rumors of a 'manticore'
Defeat Ravenous Scorpions
Gather the Stinger of the 'Manticore' as evidence

string.comment: Default Dialogue - before requirements are met
string.speaker: Razin Samara
string.name: RazinSamara

resources.string: Hearken to the words of the blessed Pontifex Charmion! She speaks for the gods and dispenses their wisdom!

string.comment: Gives Quest - Audience with the Pontifex
string.speaker: Razin Samara
string.name: RazinSamara

resources.string: New Corsica welcomes you, pilgrim.

string.comment: Gives Quest - Audience with the Pontifex
string.speaker: Razin Samara
string.name: RazinSamara

resources.string: If you wish an audience with the blessed Pontifex Charmion, you must meditate on the wisdom of the Sacred Scroll of Awakening.
Audience with the Pontifex

Prelate Razin has blocked you from speaking with Pontifex Charmion until you have gained an understanding of the True Gods, and the threat posed the Legion. Read the ‘Legacy of Rome’, then speak with the Prelate again.
“Will that grant me a vision?”
It will reveal the truth of what afflicts this land. It must be made known to all who enter here.
Go to the sacred scroll, embrace its wisdom. It will place you on the path to enlightenment.
“Is enlightenment profitable?”
Once you have done so, the Pontifex will acknowledge you as a Seeker of Truth. She can be very generous to seekers. Go forth and seek!
You must meditate on the Sacred Scroll of Awakening if you wish to speak to Pontifex Charmion.
The Light of Truth has blessed you! Now, speak to the Pontifex. You will benefit from her wisdom.
Read the tome, 'Legacy of Rome'
Prayer alone will not save us! The gods require deeds! Words without action are empty!
Power of the Gods
Pontifex Charmion has requested that you seek out Pontiff Nuru in the Cradle of Nu and offer her aid.

string.comment: Pontifex Charmion Power of the Gods Intro
string.speaker: Pontifex Charmion
string.name: PontifexCharmion

resources.string: New Corsica has lost its way! We have displeased the gods and now evil sweeps over these lands led by a terrible demon!
If we do not prove ourselves worthy, the gods will never return! We must prepare the way! An age of enlightenment awaits us!
“Which demon is that exactly?”
General Crassus, curse his name! Once trusted with our defense and considered a hero, he and his legionaries now ravage the land as bloodthirsty Corrupted!
May Atum strip the flesh from his bones!
“You looking for new hero?”
Have the gods sent you? Let me look upon you… Yes! Praise Osiris! I can see it!
Go to the Jagged Ridge. My acolyte Nuru seeks the gods’ protection there. Aid her however you can! New Corsica needs you!
Have you aided Nuru? The gods whisper to me of your great destiny here.
The Pontifex sent you? Oh, praise the gods! I cannot possibly accomplish this task on my own.
“Good thing I’m here then.”
Yes! My fervent prayers have been answered. The gods are indeed merciful. Our work can finally begin.
Seek out Pontiff Nuru within the Cradle of Nu
The Sleeping Vessels
Search the wreckage for materials to craft Pontiff Nuru’s relic.

string.comment: Akila Nuru The Sleeping Vessels Intro
string.speaker: Akila Nuru
string.name: AkilaNuru

resources.string: The idols here were once vessels for the gods. The Pontifex believes that with the proper holy relic, we may call upon their power to aid us in our time of need.
“By ‘gods’, you mean the Ancients?”
Some in this land call the gods the Ancients. The people of New Corsica call them the Blessed Nine.
But names do not matter. We only need acknowledge our creators as all-powerful.
“The gods haven’t stopped Crassus.”
They sent you, did they not? We are but humble instruments of the gods. They clearly intend for us to stop Crassus together.
“Great. How do we do that?”
With the power of these idols. But first, we must awaken them.
We’ll need a holy relic for that. Could you help me construct it? The surrounding vessels should have the required materials.
Have you found the materials for the holy relic? Without them, I cannot awaken these sacred vessels.
Yes, this is precisely what I need. Now, let me see… the design must be strictly followed…
“You've built a holy relic before?”
Well, in truth, no. But the Pontifex gave me detailed instructions. She consulted her sacred texts brought from Egypt. She is very wise.
Travel to {POITags} and search the wreckage for materials
Gather {itemName}s from Collapsed Idols
Gems of the Immortals
Pontiff Nuru has asked you to defeat Anubian Automata and Constructs, and collect the gems they possess.

string.comment: Akila Nuru Gems of the Immortals Intro
string.speaker: Akila Nuru
string.name: AkilaNuru

resources.string: The relic’s dimensions must be precise. A hand in length, a palm in breadth, two digits in height… Yes, that’s correct!
“Doesn’t look like much.”
It’s not finished. It requires gems to channel the gods' divine power. The idols possess such gems as eyes.
With the relic completed, we'll be able to awaken the vessel in the sarcophagus - the Hand of Anubis!
“He sounds impressive.”
He would be a powerful ally. We have suffered so much. The gods must surely know our need is great.
You can find gems near the Visions of Isis.
Those gems should be the final pieces I require. New Corsica depends upon our success!
You have the gems! Wonderful! Now I must arrange them in a pattern pleasing to the gods. Yes, that seems right…
“It is prettier now.”
Shh! I must pray. Hear me Atum, Shu, and Isis! Hearken Seth, Osiris, and Nut! Attend me Geb, Tefnut, and Nephthys!
Awaken your guardians and grant us their power! Earth calls to heaven! Let us be united as one!
Defeat Anubian Automata and Constructs in {POITags}, and collect their gems for Pontiff Nuru
Collect {itemName} from Anubian Automata and Constructs
There! The holy relic is done. It’s far more beautiful than I imagined. I put the hope of New Corsica in your hands, noble hero.
Awakening Anubis
Pontiff Nuru has asked you to use the holy relic at the sarcophagus to awaken the Hand of Anubis.
“How does it work?”
Place it carefully on the sarcophagus. It will awaken the vessel slumbering within and place it under your control.
Assuming the gods deem us worthy.
“And if they don’t?”
We must have faith. New Corsica has lived according to the will of the gods for centuries. We must be worthy!
But do be careful, please.
I am praying for the gods to protect you when you use the relic.
It awoke and went berserk? Oh gods, no! I followed the Pontifex’s instruction to the letter! My prayer must have been insufficient.
“Or maybe no one’s listening.”
Do not speak such blasphemy! I'm sorry… please forgive me. Clearly I was unworthy.
Find and open the sealed sarcophagus in {POITags}
Awaken the Ancient Idol with the use of the Blessed Relic
Defeat the enraged Ancient Idol
Insufficient Faith
Report Pontiff Nuru’s failure to awaken the Anubian vessels to Pontifex Charmion.
I have failed the people of New Corsica and exposed you to terrible danger. Please forgive my unworthiness.
“I don’t think you’re unworthy.”
No, there is no other explanation. The gods are blameless so the fault must lie with me. The Pontifex will not be pleased…
“Wasn’t this her plan?”
The plan was sound. It was the instrument that failed.
Tell her I will accept whatever punishment she deems appropriate. But thank you for your help, noble hero.
I am ready to receive the Pontifex’s judgement.
Nuru failed?! That is a great disappointment and it will cost New Corsica dearly.
I misjudged Nuru’s ability and faith. I shall not make that mistake again.
“This wasn’t her fault.”
Are you implying that the fault lay with the gods? Blasphemy! They must never be questioned! The failure is Nuru’s.
Well, perhaps not hers alone. You were there as well, were you not?
Please allow me time for quiet reflection. I must pray for forgiveness and seek to atone for my failure.
Report Nuru's failure to Pontifex Charmion in New Corsica
Cursed Across Centuries
Speak with Ariel Gideon about the plan to fight the 19th Legion, then find Tribune Kraus on the Scorched Battlefield.
New Corsica is in desperate need of able-bodied heroes.
The Corrupted Legion will overrun this city unless we can find a way to stop them.
“Is that why the city is barren?”
Yes, most of our citizens have fled. A brave few volunteered to fight against Crassus.
Tribune Alaina Kraus reports our prospects are grim. We are outnumbered and the Corrupted legionaries are merciless.
“How long has this been going on?”
The feud with General Crassus started centuries ago, before my time here. It is said he committed sacrilege by invading sacred Akhet, the temple of the gods.
This act unleashed Medusa’s Curse upon the land.
“Medusa’s Curse?”
It turned Crassus and his legion to stone. Several New Corsicans as well. But Crassus and his men freed themselves through an unholy pact with Corruption.
Perhaps you could help Tribune Kraus stop the 19th Legion?
If you truly wish to help New Corsica, seek Tribune Kraus on the Scorched Battlefield.
Reinforcements? Thank the stars! I had almost given up hope.
“Are you the only one here?”
Everyone else has fled or become Lost. I’ve managed to keep out of sight, scouting the enemy’s position. It doesn’t look good for us.
Your courage has given New Corsica a chance to resist Crassus. The people thank you!
Travel to the Scorched Battlefield to assist Alaina in the fight against the Legion
Assault Against the Legion
Tribune Kraus has asked you to defeat 19th Legion troops in their war camps.

string.comment: Alaina Kraus Tides of War Intro
string.speaker: Alaina Kraus
string.name: AlainaKraus

resources.string: Crassus has split his legion. He has taken the First Cohort to assault Akhet.

string.comment: Alaina Kraus Tides of War Intro
string.speaker: Alaina Kraus
string.name: AlainaKraus

resources.string: I believe he intends to invade the sacred temple as he did centuries ago.
"And the troops out there?"
They seem to be preparing a strike against New Corsica, but I can’t be sure. There’s too many of them and I can’t get a closer look.
"I can thin out their ranks."
That would be helpful in many ways. The fewer Corrupted, the greater the chance that New Corsica can be saved.
But be careful, those are trained Roman legionaries fueled by Corruption.
We must thin out the 19th Legion’s numbers.
That was most impressive! While you were engaging those legionaries, I managed to get a closer look.
“What's your assessment?”
The situation is even more grim, I'm afraid. I spied a large number of siege weapons. I’m certain now they intend to attack New Corsica.
Assault the 19th Legion in {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
The Hydra's Breath
Tribune Kraus has asked you to steal Hydra’s Breath from the 19th Legion to help destroy the enemy's siege weapons.

string.comment: Alaina Kraus The Hydra's Breath Intro
string.speaker: Alaina Kraus
string.name: AlainaKraus

resources.string: Your courage and skill are inspiring, but the sight of those siege engines darkens my hopes.

string.comment: Alaina Kraus The Hydra's Breath Intro
string.speaker: Alaina Kraus
string.name: AlainaKraus

resources.string: The 19th Legion is a formidable enough enemy without them.
“Tell me about this 19th Legion.”
They’re Crassus’s army, formed by Mark Antony in Egypt during Cleopatra’s rebellion.
They were sent by Antony to find the secret of immortality in the land of the gods. That’s how they came to be here.
“Wait, how old are you?”
Oh, I’m not a native New Corsican. Only Crassus, the 19th, the Pontifex, and a few others came from Egypt.
Most of us settled here over the years from other parts of Aeternum. It’s my home now and I intend to defend it.
"We should destroy the siege weapons."
I know how we can do it. Raid the enemy’s camp and return with Hydra’s Breath.
This incendiary weapon should do the trick. If you can, eliminate their alchemist Ignatius and destroy his tools. He’s a brutal animal.
Without casks of Hydra’s Breath, we have no chance of destroying those siege engines.
Excellent work! With the power of Hydra’s Breath in our possession, we now have a fighting chance.
“I took care of that alchemist.”
Good! I’ve seen that man burn New Corsican soldiers alive. That monster deserved to be sent to hell.
You should have a taste of my Hydra's Breath! It's sure to leave a lasting impression!
There's nothing like the smell of burning flesh! It's invigorating!
I'll watch you roast! By Hades, I swear it!
How dare you rob the world of my genius! You deserve to burn!
Travel to {POITags} and search for Hydra's Breath, then eliminate the Legion's Alchemist
Destroy the Alchemy Workstations
Search chests for {itemName}
Eliminate {targetName}
Collect the Alchemist's possessions
A Blaze of Glory
Tribune Kraus has asked you to destroy the 19th Legion's artillery and defeat Primus Vespasian.

string.comment: Alaina Kraus A Blaze of Glory Intro
string.speaker: Alaina Kraus
string.name: AlainaKraus

resources.string: Well done, noble hero! This Hydra’s Breath will burn those blasted siege weapons to the ground!
“I found this vial and a scroll.”
Hmm, I’ve never seen anything like the substance in this vial. It’s very strange. The scroll is written in Greek. It’s a formula for something.
“Hydra’s Breath?”
The vial does give off an unusual glow, but it’s not Hydra’s Breath. It's infused with Azoth. I’ll need time to translate the Greek.
"I’ll destroy siege weapons."
Approach with caution! Primus Vespasian guards the siege weapons. He’s a former gladiator and his skills are legendary. Best of luck, hero!
If Ignatius’s words are true, our time is short. You must destroy the artillery.
Ah, what a victory! New Corsica shall be spared destruction by fire. We are in your debt.
Ah and I finished the translation. The substance in the vial is an elixir called Panacea.
“Is it medicine?”
Good guess! It can reverse Medusa’s Curse. I wonder if that’s how the Legion freed themselves from their petrification?
But now that you possess a vial, I believe you can help New Corsica further.
Hunt down Primus Vespasian in {POITags}, then destroy the Legion's artillery
Destroy Legion Artillery
The Last True Centurion
Tribune Kraus has asked you to find and restore the New Corsican hero Evandrus.

string.comment: Alaina Kraus The Last True Centurion Intro
string.speaker: Alaina Kraus
string.name: AlainaKraus

resources.string: You must find the noble Evandrus Crassus! He may prove a great ally to our cause!
“Did you say Evandrus Crassus?”
He is Crassus’s son! Turned to stone all those centuries ago. His petrified body rests at the Legion’s old fort.
Tales of his noble deeds are legendary. New Corsicans lay wreaths at his feet for good luck.
“Could he have been restored?”
If so he would’ve come to New Corsica by now. He loved his people. And if anyone would know the mind of General Crassus, it would be him.
Please find him. If he is still stone, restore him, I beg you!
"What if he’s Corrupted?"
I dare not contemplate such a horror! Not for a noble soul like Evandrus.
But if such is his fate, please release him from that hellish torment.
Restore Evandrus! He is the ally we need!
Uhhh… my vision swims with shadows… am I still dreaming…? What has happened?
“Easy now, Tribune Kraus sent me.”
Who? Where is my father? The other centurions?
I recall a blinding flash in the sky… then.. then a thunderous roar… Then darkness…
Your deeds will never be forgotten! New Corsica would be fortunate to have you as a citizen!

string.comment: Pontifex Charmion Default Greet After Evandrus Awakened
string.speaker: Pontifex Charmion
string.name: PontifexCharmion

resources.string: What will become of us? Repent before it is too late! I pray the gods have mercy upon us all!
Travel to {POITags} and search for the statue of Evandrus Crassus
Find and restore Evandrus using the Panacea
A Legend Restored
Inform the newly awakened Evandrus of the current invasion then report back to Tribune Kraus.

string.comment: Evandrus Crassus A Legend Restored Intro
string.speaker: Evandrus Crassus
string.name: EvandrusCrassus

resources.string: You are not familiar to me. And I do not know a Tribune Kraus. Where is everyone? What happened to the fort?
“You were stone for a long time.”
How? Were we attacked? I recall my father was marching to Akhet. He left me and a small garrison to guard the fort.
Did he and the Legion suffer a similar fate?
“They’re back and Corrupted.”
No, no, that cannot be! My father and the proud 19th Legion? Claimed by Corruption?!
"They intend to invade New Corsica."
Great gods! This is too much! I must go to the city at once! If Tribune Kraus fights for New Corsica, return and report what has happened here!
I shall return to New Corsica as soon as my head has cleared. There is so much to consider…
Evandrus has been restored? Praise be! Our fortunes are certain to change! Where is he? What does he intend to do?
“He’s heading back to New Corsica.”
Good! I’ll return to defend the city as soon as I’m able. It would be an honor to fight alongside the noble Evandrus. Thank you, hero!

string.comment: Evandrus Crassus Final Greet After Being Awakened
string.speaker: Evandrus Crassus
string.name: EvandrusCrassus

resources.string: So much has changed. How could I have been dreaming for so long? I must gather my wits about me…
Report the news of Evandrus's return to Tribune Kraus.
A Hero No More
Inform Evandrus that Charmion commands him to return to New Corsica.

string.comment: Pontifex Charmion In Enemy Territory Intro
string.speaker: Pontifex Charmion
string.name: PontifexCharmion

resources.string: Be warned, New Corsica! The tyrant’s son has returned! We must be vigilant! There is a venomous serpent in our midst!
“What are you talking about?”
Deceiver! I believed you to be sent by the gods! Now I see you for who you truly are!
You had a hand in releasing the traitor Evandrus! Confess your sin before the gods!
“I was told he was a hero.”
Lies! Would a hero abandon New Corsica in our hour of need? Nay, that villain has gone to aid our enemies!
His only loyalty is to those Corrupted legionaries and their vicious master!
"I don't believe that."
See for yourself! He has gone to the Rise of Sutekh where our enemy makes their camp.
Find Evandrus and order him to return to New Corsica! If he refuses, then prove yourself worthy and slay him!
Atone for your sins! Find Evandrus and deal with him!
It is good to see a familiar face! What news do you bring?
“The Pontifex wants you dead.”
She's convinced I'll betray New Corsica. She's lost her mind. There was no time to debate her.
I must learn what these legionaries plan to do. If they mean to invade New Corsica, I must try to stop them.
Find Evandrus in the Legion-controlled highlands
Ultimate Intentions
Evandrus has asked that you infiltrate the Corrupted Legion camp and steal their communications.
Prefect Drusilla commands these soldiers. She’s a bloodthirsty warmonger who serves only her own ambition.
I always considered her a disgrace to the Legion. The Corruption must have found its way into the 19th through her.
"The Corruption freed the Legion?”
The power of that insidious sickness is unknown to me. Charmion insists it was my father's blasphemous pact that freed the Legion.
But I cannot believe that is true. My father is a good man.
"Those soldiers out there aren't.”
Yes, you speak true. Corruption has infected Drusilla and the centurions under her command. There is no denying that.
They must be stopped.
“How do we stop an army?”
My father always said that knowing your enemy’s mind is vital to devising a stratagem.
Their courier camp should have their deployment reports. If you acquire them, they could reveal their intentions.
The sooner we can get those deployment reports, the sooner we can formulate our plan.
You have the reports! Excellent! Hmm, it seems someone has made an impression on them. I take it that was you?
“I tend to have that effect.”
You’ve certainly had that effect on Drusilla. She’s determined to discover who you are. But even more importantly, you’ve made her nervous.
I believe I see an opportunity to strike at her.
Infiltrate the Corrupted Legion camp at {POITags} and locate any correspondence
Search the camp for any vital correspondence
Find "Drusilla's Devotion"
Collect the Legion Reports
Strength and Weakness
Destroy the 19th Legion's supplies and slay Centurion Magnus.

string.comment: Evandrus Crassus Sabotage the Legion's Supplies Intro
string.speaker: Evandrus Crassus
string.name: EvandrusCrassus

resources.string: Drusilla has a bodyguard named Magnus. He’s a giant of a Gaul who could kill most men with his bare hands.

string.comment: Evandrus Crassus Sabotage the Legion's Supplies Intro
string.speaker: Evandrus Crassus
string.name: EvandrusCrassus

resources.string: The other centurions greatly fear and respect him. He is a symbol of Drusilla’s power.
"Sounds like Magnus needs to die.”
I never did like that brute. I’d be happy to have him sent to the Underworld.
But it will not be enough. We need to cripple the Legion’s ability to fight a prolonged conflict.
"An army marches on its stomach.”
That is a fact. Destroying their supplies and armaments would have a significant impact on their fighting strength.
Set fire to the camp supply depots and cut that oaf Magnus down to size.
Give my regards to that brute Magnus, would you?
By the helm of Mars! I can hear the chaos you've unleashed on the camp from here!
Drusilla must be feeling the cold touch of the Underworld without Magnus to protect her!
"What do you think she'll do?"
As she said in her letter, she'll take shelter with one of her trusted tribunes. The question is which one?
Travel to {POITags} and destroy the Legion's supplies, then slay Centurion Magnus
Destroy the Legion Supplies
Defeat {targetName}
Eliminate {targetName}
One Tribune at a Time
In order to weaken Drusilla, you must take out her tribunes, one by one.

string.comment: Evandrus Crassus The Hit List Intro
string.speaker: Evandrus Crassus
string.name: EvandrusCrassus

resources.string: The success of your raids has left the camp in disarray! Drusilla will seek to close ranks with her tribunes. She’s always so predictable.
“Who put her in charge?”
Mark Antony made her a tribune because he needed commanders against Octavian in Egypt. Drusilla’s ruthless tactics seemingly impressed him.
My father promoted her to prefect when we arrived on Aeternum to reward her loyalty.
"You don’t seem very impressed."
An able military commander requires more than brutality. She’s ill-suited to strategy.
Even after Magnus’s defeat, she seeks to shield herself behind her tribunes? So predictable.
"Who are these tribunes?”
Ciara, a Celt Horse Master; Elias and his wolves; Ursula the Gladiatrix; and the Greek twins, Castor and Pollux.
End them and Drusilla’s strength will crumble.
Eliminating five highly trained tribunes would be too great a task for most, but I feel you are different.
Five Tribunes of the 19th Legion felled in battle! Even the mighty Achilles would be impressed!
Now Drusilla will take shelter in the Legion’s headquarters, I’m certain of it.
"I'll draw the wolf from its den."
Yes, precisely so! If I had a cohort of centurions such as you, I could dictate the fate of New Corsica.
Travel to {POITags} and seek out Tribune Ciara and Gladiatrix Ursula
Search for Tribune Elias in {POITags}
Locate and defeat the twins, Castor and Pollux, in {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat Castor and Pollux
Head of the Snake
Destroy the Legion’s command tents and defeat Prefect Drusilla.

string.comment: Evandrus Crassus Head of the Snake Intro
string.speaker: Evandrus Crassus
string.name: EvandrusCrassus

resources.string: Drusilla must feel as if she’s stalked by Nemesis herself. I wouldn’t be surprised if the invasion of New Corsica was entirely her design.
