"She was reporting to Crassus.”
Yes, I cannot deny that, though I wish it were not so.
Further, I’ve verified that my father and the First Cohort are laying siege to the Great Pyramid of Akhet.
“Why is he doing that?”
Before the Curse struck, he intended to secure the temple. Charmion and her zealots believed it was a gateway to the gods.
But my father knew it was dangerous. He sought to prevent anyone from tampering with unknown forces.
“Something obviously went wrong.”
Yes, terribly wrong. And we must put things to right starting here.
Burn the command tents and set the 19th's banner ablaze. We will smoke out Drusilla and end her threat.
Drusilla's shade is long overdue in the Underworld. Send her on her way.
By Jupiter, you’ve done it! Drusilla’s defeat has already begun to scatter the Legion’s forces. In salute of you, noble hero!
"Drusilla had a letter from Crassus."
Merciful Juno, these are the words of... of a mad tyrant. Now, this cannot be the noble Roman Legatus I once knew.
But I recognize his hand, his bold script I… Father… what has become of you…?
Travel to {POITags} and burn the command tents of the Legion to draw out Drusilla, then defeat her
Destroy Command Tents
Destroy the first command tent
Destroy the second command tent
Destroy the last command tent
Ignite the Legion banner to draw out Drusilla
Defeat Legatus Drusilla
Retrieve the "Letter from Crassus"
You are the cause of my woes! I'll skin you alive!
There's no stopping the might of Rome! Die, barbarian!
Your tactics are laughable! You fight like a bloody Pict!
After all the trouble you caused me, I expected more!
I'm done toying with you! Your carcass will feed the wolves!
Impossible… you are no one… nothing…
Sic Transit Gloria Mundi
Return to Charmion with news of your success against Drusilla's forces.

string.comment: Evandrus Crassus Sic Transit Gloria Mundi Intro
string.speaker: Evandrus Crassus
string.name: EvandrusCrassus

resources.string: I humbly beg your pardon. This letter… comes as a terrible shock…
"I’m sorry, Evandrus.”
I am grateful, my friend. I must think only of my duty to New Corsica. Her safety is all that matters now.
"Did you know Crassus’s intentions?"
He dreamed of bringing the peace and order of the Republic to Aeternum. But not like this.
He wanted to secure the power of the Ennead, to keep it safe, not to claim it for his own.
“What power does the Ennead hold?”
Charmion believes it is the power of the gods themselves. Myself, I am not so certain.
Return to New Corsica and inform Charmion of Drusilla’s defeat. I will join you as soon as I am able.
Inform Charmion that Drusilla and her centurions have been defeated.
You allowed Evandrus to live? Your victory against Drusilla proves nothing!
He simply wanted to remove a rival for his father’s affections. Now you have joined in his betrayal!
“You’re insane.”
The gods will return and deliver their divine judgement! They cursed this land once and will do so again! I swear it!
Osiris calls to me... Can you not hear his sublime voice? My ascension awaits...

string.comment: Evandrus Crassus Default Greet in New Corsica
string.speaker: Evandrus Crassus
string.name: EvandrusCrassus

resources.string: The defense of New Corsica continues. Steel yourself for the coming conflict.
Return to New Corsica and tell Charmion of your success against the Legion
Secrets in the Sands
Speak to Pontiff Nuru at the Ancients' Rise and help her uncover the secrets of the Ennead.

string.comment: Evandrus Crassus Report to the Ancient Rise Intro
string.speaker: Evandrus Crassus
string.name: EvandrusCrassus

resources.string: There you are, friend! I’ve spoken to Prefect Severan. He’s recalling the remaining Praetorians and securing the city.

string.comment: Evandrus Crassus Report to the Ancient Rise Intro
string.speaker: Evandrus Crassus
string.name: EvandrusCrassus

resources.string: Did you speak to Charmion?
"She’s insane, Evandrus.”
Severan warned me that her mind was slipping. I will have to ask him to have her watched.
We must continue our mission to discover what my father and the First Cohort seek in the Ennead.
"Charmion promises divine wrath."
If the Ennead unleashed Medusa’s Curse, that threat must be taken seriously.
Pontiff Nuru is at the Ancients' Rise, looking into the Ennead’s mysteries. See what she has discovered and aid her if you can.
What has Pontiff Nuru discovered at the Ancients' Rise? Her findings may be our salvation.
My relic-builder! It’s so good to see you again!
“I’m glad you weren't executed.”
She stripped me of my rank and expelled me from the Order, so there’s that. She said I had lost my faith.
I’m now an apostate. Although I have not lost my faith. I simply wish to search for truth.
Speak to Pontiff Nuru in the Ancients' Rise
Miracles and Madness
Recover Charmion’s journal and the Great Ennead Codex to reveal the secrets of Akhet.
One thing has become clear to me: The Pontifex has lost her reason. The long centuries have proven too much for her mind. For her, immortality proved to be a curse.
“Yeah, she’s crazy all right.”
She possesses such knowledge. She was once Cleopatra’s handmaiden, a priestess of Egypt.
Can you imagine the events she must have witnessed? The deeds she must have performed?
“She’s been lying to everyone.”
I fear that's true. She knows far more about what really happened to Crassus and the 19th Legion.
She rarely speaks of the early days of New Corsica. We must uncover the truth.
“What are we looking for?”
The Pontifex spoke a few times of tablets known as the Great Ennead Codex.
Before the Curse, she and her scribes traveled along the Road of Atum studying Akhet. I would focus your search for the Codex there.
Did you find the journal and the Codex tablets? We must learn what we can about Akhet.
You’ve found the Codex! And the Pontifex’s journal as well! Praise the gods! Whatever they may actually be…
“Can you read the Codex?”
It’s written in Hieratic, which the Pontifex taught me to read.
It seems she translated many of the strange glyphs from the Codex in her journal. Yes, I can read this!
Search for Charmion's Journal in {POITags}
Seek out the Great Ennead Codex Tablets along the {POITags}
Recover the pages of Charmion's Journal
Collect the Great Ennead Codex Tablets
Hieratic Truth
You must gather pieces of the Prime Key.

string.comment: Akila Nuru The Prime Key Intro
string.speaker: Akila Nuru
string.name: AkilaNuru

resources.string: Oh goodness, it seems the Pontifex once loved Crassus. She calls him by his first name, Lucius. She’s even written romantic poetry about him…
"Anything important in there?”
Oh, gods... Crassus did not release Medusa’s Curse. It was the Pontifex!
She attempted to open some sort of gate in the Ennead without the proper key. The Curse was the result! It was her...
“What kind of gate?”
She believes it is the 12th Gate, which opens to the home of the gods. The Pontifex sought to bring them here.
I don’t believe the Ennead leads to the gods. And I fear Crassus may unleash something truly horrific.
"How do we get this key?”
It was called the Prime Key and it was broken into pieces. Guardians collected the pieces to protect them.
The Pontifex narrowed the locations down to a specific section of the highway. Let’s pray she was right.
Have you recovered the pieces of the Prime Key? We may not have much time left.
You recovered the pieces! Praise the Blessed Nine! Sorry, force of habit…
“Do we need to assemble it?”
You're getting good at this! Once it is whole, I'm hoping we can use the Prime Key to keep Crassus from destroying Aeternum.
Return to the {POITags} and search for Prime Key Fragments
Retrieve Prime Key Fragments from enemies throughout {POITags}
The Key that was Broken
Destroy the Lore Keeper and reforge the Prime Key.

string.comment: Akila Nuru The Forge of Ptah Intro
string.speaker: Akila Nuru
string.name: AkilaNuru

resources.string: According to the Codex, the Prime Key can be reassembled in something called the Forge of Ptah.

string.comment: Akila Nuru The Forge of Ptah Intro
string.speaker: Akila Nuru
string.name: AkilaNuru

resources.string: It requires a special code to ignite it, but I believe that code can be found near the forge itself.
"Didn’t we try something like this?”
Yes, but we were using an Egyptian text to try and control powers on Aeternum.
These instructions were written by the ancient people who built Akhet and who actually used the Prime Key.
“Fair point. Proceed.”
The forge is protected by an entity called the Lore Keeper. He sounds ominous.
He guards a vault-like chamber where the ignition code for the forge is kept. You’ll definitely need that.
“What do I do with the fragments?”
Not according to the Codex. Just place the pieces inside the forge and enter the code on the dials.
Here’s hoping for more success than last time. I’ll whisper a prayer for good luck. I figure it couldn’t hurt.
Did you reforge the Prime Key? I can’t wait to see what it looks like.
You’re alive! Thank the gods! And you’ve reforged the Prime Key!
“Did you have any doubt?”
Barely a hint of it, really. But I’m glad it was completely unfounded!
Travel to {POITags} and defeat the Lore Keeper, then reforge the Prime Key
Defeat {targetName}
Collect the {itemName} and use it to start the forge
Reforge the Prime Key with the Forge of Ptah
The people of New Corsica need a better way forward. Not a new faith, but a fresh interpretation for changing times.
With my knowledgeable guidance, of course. I've no intention of going anywhere.
Circles in Time
Report what you have discovered about Akhet and the reforged Prime Key to Evandrus.

string.comment: Akila Nuru A Date with Destiny Intro
string.speaker: Akila Nuru
string.name: AkilaNuru

resources.string: With the Prime Key, I believe we now have hope of stopping Crassus and preventing another curse from being unleashed upon the land.
"How do we use the Prime Key?”
The Codex mentions glyphs in the Forge of Ptah that speak of the Key’s function.
Now that you’ve destroyed that monstrous Lore Keeper, I can go there and study them.
“You can decipher Ancient glyphs?”
With the help of the Pontifex’s notes, I believe I can.
Despite her actions and current state, none of this would have been possible without her knowledge.
“What does the Prime Key do?”
If it can open the gate, perhaps it can also seal it. Crassus was right about one thing; the Ennead is too dangerous to tamper with.
Tell Evandrus what we’ve discovered. I’ll join you in New Corsica after I decipher these glyphs.
Tell Evandrus what we’ve done. Tell him there is hope for New Corsica!
The hero of New Corsica returns! And bearing gifts! What is that strange device?
“The key to New Corsica’s salvation.”
I believe that is you, my friend. Only the crisis at the Ennead remains to be dealt with. It is time we confronted the sins of our past.

string.comment: Evandrus Crassus Default Greet After Nuru Quests
string.speaker: Evandrus Crassus
string.name: EvandrusCrassus

resources.string: There are many evils that plague this land. Soon there will have to be a reckoning.
Return to Evandrus in New Corsica with the news of Akhet and the reforged Prime Key
The Mighty Must Fall (Expedition)
Evandrus has asked you to go to the Ennead and confront his father General Crassus.

string.comment: Evandrus Crassus End Crassus's Threat Intro
string.speaker: Evandrus Crassus
string.name: EvandrusCrassus

resources.string: I wanted to believe that the noble man who sacrificed so much, the loyal soul who loved friends and family, the champion who diligently protected the people of New Corsica, still existed.

string.comment: Evandrus Crassus End Crassus's Threat Intro
string.speaker: Evandrus Crassus
string.name: EvandrusCrassus

resources.string: But I must face the truth.
“There is only Corruption now.”
I was hoping that terrible plague could be resisted by someone with a noble heart and a strong mind.
But how could Charmion not have fallen to Corruption after all these centuries?
"Perhaps her madness shielded her."
Yes, one would think such an affliction would hasten the process. But in any case, New Corsica is free of her. Charmion has fled the city.
The people have rallied behind me, thanks to you.
"What about the curse she unleashed?"
It was her doing? Great gods! We cannot risk such a thing happening again. You must stop my father from unleashing more horrors upon us.
And please, make sure he finds true peace.
Release my father from his torment, I beg you. His threat to New Corsica must be ended.
Hail, hero of New Corsica! The people have named me their new Legatus.
As my first official duty, I welcome you home. So, what news do you bring?
“Crassus spoke of you at the end.”
Forgive my tears, dear friend… I shall honor his memory by devoting myself to New Corsica’s prosperity.
It’s what the noble Lucius Decimus Crassus would have done. We sincerely thank you, for everything.
Hail, hero of New Corsica! Your deeds shall endure as long as the stars!

string.comment: Pontifex Charmion Final Greet After Evandrus Quests
string.speaker: Pontifex Charmion
string.name: PontifexCharmion

resources.string: I must prepare the way… I do this for you, my beloved… enlightenment will come to the people…
Venture into the Ennead Expedition to confront General Crassus
Defeat {targetName}
The Final Seal (Expedition)
Enter the Pyramid of Akhet and seal the Ennead with the Prime Key to protect the people of Aeternum.

string.comment: Akila Nuru Sealing the Ennead Intro
string.speaker: Akila Nuru
string.name: AkilaNuru

resources.string: There you are! I’ve finished translating the glyphs in the Forge of Ptah. I know the purpose of the Prime Key.
“I always knew you were brilliant.”
Thank you! Charmion was wrong. The Ennead is not a gate to be opened. It must be sealed.
When Charmion attempted to use the Ennead without the Prime Key, she unleashed calamity.
“What would sealing it do?”
Honestly, I don't know. The builders of Akhet may have been gods. Or perhaps just humans.
In any event, the Prime Key was vital to the Ennead's proper function. It could prevent further curses.
“Sounds like a big risk.”
There is no other choice. Another curse could spell doom for everyone on Aeternum. It’s a risk we must take.
Go to the Ennead, insert the Prime Key. This time, we both must have faith. Good luck!
You must insert the Prime Key into the Ennead. Its power is too dangerous to leave uncontained.
That beam of celestial light is the most beautiful thing I’ve ever seen! Could this have been how the builders of Akhet spoke with their gods?
“So, you’re a believer again?”
I never stopped believing. And since Evandrus named me the new Pontifex, belief is a crucial requirement.
Thank you, friend. You’ve transformed this land. May the gods smile upon you. Always.
The gods of this land bless you, noble hero. You are truly their chosen champion.
Venture into the Ennead Expedition to activate the Prime Key
Activate the Prime Key in the Ennead:
Activate the six Glyph Consoles throughout the Ennead
The Eternal Court (East)
The Eternal Court (West)
Verdant Locus
Broken Tomb
Remnants of Royalty
Timeless Crypt
Destroy {targetName}
Confront whatever lurks in the heart of the temple
Insert the Prime Key in the Ancient Console
Rally to me, Romans! Prepare to send those damned beasts to the underworld!
The power of the Ennead is within our grasp! Stand fast, soldiers of Rome!
Fight, Romans! We’ve sacrificed everything for this! We must claim it!
Ignorant dog! You will pay dearly for this intrusion!
You cannot contend against the might of Rome!
Another of Charmion’s “champions?” You pitiful fool!
Die, cur!
Begone, dog!
Enough, scum!
Drusilla should’ve killed you!
We are an unstoppable tide!
I will bring this land to its knees!
This power belongs to us, not the gods!
We have paid for this power with our souls!
The glory of Rome will ignite Aeternum!
Feel the rage that burns inside!
Behold the power given to me!
Evandrus... my noble son... where are you...?
It was all a lie... please forgive me, Evandrus…
What have I done...? Evandrus, I failed you…
All hail the might of Rome!

string.comment: Post Ennead Expedition, Nuru is Pontifex (Razin is unhappy and sarcastic)
string.speaker: Razin Samara
string.name: RazinSamara

resources.string: Attend the words of the Pontifex Nuru. Her wisdom will guide us into a new age of enlightenment.

string.comment: Post Ennead Expedition, Nuru is Pontifex (Razin is unhappy and sarcastic)
string.speaker: Razin Samara
string.name: RazinSamara

resources.string: I'm sure you're as eager as I am to witness such a miracle.

string.comment: Default Dialogue - before MSQ requirements met
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: Stay together!<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" /> There’s strength in numbers!

string.comment: Default Dialogue - before MSQ requirements met
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: Ready what weapons you have, but be prepared to run if it comes to that. Don’t lose hope!

string.comment: Default Dialogue - before MSQ requirements met
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: Stay together!<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" /> There’s strength in numbers! Ready what weapons you have, but be prepared to run if it comes to that. Don’t lose hope!

<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" bin="1" bout="1.5" />You there! You have a heroic look about you.<g id="g_litearmor_complimentplayer" bin="1" /> That steely glint in your eyes, the aura of confidence, the distinctive swagger.
Brimstone Under Siege
A troubled woman at the Refugee Caravan has warned of an impending attack by the Corrupted Legion, and has asked for your help to defend the civilians.
“Strange way to start a dialogue.”
<g id="g_litearmor_shrugbrief" bin="1" bout="2" />When I want something. We’re in desperate need of capable warriors!
<g id="g_litearmor_worry" />A terrible enemy, the Corrupted Legion, lays siege to this land. These people are trying to<g id="g_female_gesturelefts" /> flee the conflict and get to safety.
“Are you their leader?”
<g id="g_male_headshakeno" />No, I’m just helping however<g id="g_litearmor_handheart" /> I can. I am Ghazi Laghmani, a scribe and scholar.
<g id="g_litearmor_concerns" priority="high" />We have no way to fight these fearsome<g id="g_female_handsforwardrequest" /> foes. But I’m hoping you do. Can you help us?
“I always defend the helpless.”

Ah, we’re in luck then! I feel<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" bin="2" bout="2" /> an attack on this camp is imminent. They're<g id="g_female_gestureforward01" bin="2" bout="2" /> likely to come from the northwest. Could you scout the sands in that direction?
I pray you're as<g id="g_female_flirtsmall" bin="2" /> capable as you look!

<g id="g_litearmor_pleadhandsopen" priority="high" />These people are refugees, not soldiers. They can’t repel an assault by the Corrupted Legion.<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" /> Please stop those vicious murderers!
<g id="g_male_compliment" />Ha! You’ve done it! My instincts are never wrong!<g id="g_litearmor_shrugbrief" /> Well, not when it’s important.
He he!<g id="g_male_pointblame" /> You will be envied by many, admired by all, and desired by an obsessive few.
"A few, huh?”
<g id="g_female_flirtsmall" />Upon a closer inspection of such a striking visage, I amend that to many!
Now that you’ve proven yourself,<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> I am compelled to ask for your help again.
Engage the Legion before they reach the refugee camp
Defeat the waves of Legion attackers
I’m not only a scholar, I’m also a chronicler.
For the last several years, I’ve been committing to parchment the extraordinary life of<g id="g_female_explains" /> none other than “Imhotep the Wise!”
The Great Architect
Ghazi Laghmani has asked for any possible assistance in finding her teacher, the Great Sage Imhotep, last seen near The Acropolis.
“Imhotep the Wise?”
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />The Great Sage of Brimstone! Oldest<g id="g_female_leanpointconvince" /> living soul on Aeternum, friend to the Ancients, architect of the Great Pyramid at Akhet!
<g id="g_litearmor_converseright" />He is more valuable than the Library at Alexandria!
“Sounds like a living treasure.”
<g id="g_litearmor_agree1" />He’s also committed to stopping the Corrupted Legion. If anyone can do it, it’s him.
But he’s gone missing.<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" /> He does this occasionally. Well, frequently, actually,<g id="g_litearmor_shrugbrief" /> but this time I feel something terrible has happened!
“You want me to search for him?”
<g id="g_female_flirtsmall" />Heh. Am I that transparent? You’d be doing Brimstone Sands a great service.
He was<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> traveling to The Acropolis and was supposed to send word when he arrived. But it never came. Start your search there.
<g id="g_litearmor_secretiveshort" />Have you found any sign of the Great Sage Imhotep?<g id="g_litearmor_hopeless" /> We desperately need his wisdom.
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />You’ve returned! To be honest, I wasn't sure if you would.<g id="g_litearmor_takeitem5s" priority="high" /> What’s this? A journal page?
Imhotep<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" /> took Aban with him! He’s a fellow scribe and dear friend. Where could they have gone?
“The journal page didn't say.”
I must find out! But there’s a looming crisis we must deal with first. I<g id="g_female_apologetic" /> hope I'm not becoming a burden but heroes are hard to find.
Search for Imhotep within {POITags}
Search for any signs of Imhotep
Follow the trail of the discarded Legion equipment
Find the path to climb and reach the journal page
Read the journal entry, 'A Mysterious Threat'
<g id="g_male_compliment" />Your bold and effective defense of these refugees has enraged the Legion garrison at Crassus’s Rise.
<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" />They’re preparing a massive assault to wipe us all out.
Preemptive Strike

Ghazi has received word that the Corrupted Legion is preparing an even larger assault on the Caravan. While she heads north to search for Imhotep, she has asked you to attack the Legion directly at their garrison of Crassus's Rise.
“This is an actual Roman Legion?”
<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />Noticed that, did you? They’re the original Romans who<g id="g_litearmor_converseleft" /> founded New Corsica centuries ago.
They were once Brimstone’s noble protectors. But after a terrible<g id="g_male_dismissgetlost1" /> tragedy, Corruption turned them into a scourge.
“It’s always Corruption, isn’t it?”
<g id="g_male_whocares" priority="high" bout="1.5" />Don't get me started! It has been a blight on this land for thousands of years.
It was a plague<g id="g_litearmor_converseleft" /> even to the Ancients when they walked these sands. It unleashed a terrible cataclysm.
“Is that why the Ancients are gone?”
Your guess is<g id="g_female_nodshrugokay" bin="1" /> as good as mine. Not even Imhotep knows. But let's focus on the matter at hand!

<g id="g_litearmor_converseright" />The Legion fortress lies to the northwest.<g id="g_female_smackfist" /> Hit it hard. I’ll try and pick up Imhotep’s trail. I'll<g id="g_litearmor_converseleft" /> meet you outside the fortress. Good luck!
<g id="g_male_pointblame" />If you thin the ranks at the Legion garrison, that might take the fight out of those vicious brutes.<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" /> And believe me, they have it coming.

I was<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" bin="1" bout="1.5"/> hoping to see your striking visage again! And your aura of<g id="g_litearmor_agree1" /> confidence has grown. That can only mean victory, yes? Well done!
<g id="g_litearmor_complimentplayer" />The Corrupted Legion will think twice before attacking innocent refugees again.
“Back to finding Imhotep?”

<g id="g_litearmor_realize" />You read my mind, you wily oracle! Imhotep's wisdom may be the only thing<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" /> that can save us from this relentless foe. I pray he’s safe and sound.
Strike the Legion at {POITags} to prevent the attack on Wikala al-Waha
Burn the Legion's war supplies
Defeat {targetName}

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ: Stirring in the Sands
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_litearmor_sighrelief" />Luckily, my efforts to locate Imhotep have borne fruit! Aban sent a message that they were heading to Carthago.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ: Stirring in the Sands
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_litearmor_worry" />Aban seemed especially worried about our master losing himself…
Stirring in the Sands
Imhotep continues to investigate a new threat, heading west toward Carthago. Once found, Ghazi anxiously awaits news of his return at Cavalier's Rest.
“What exactly does that mean?”

<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" />I’m afraid it’s… complicated. You see, when someone lives as long as Imhotep, their mind can become<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> full and sometimes spill, like a vessel holding too much water.
Thoughts, ideas,<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" /> they can all become jumbled.
“Are you saying Imhotep is mad?”
<g id="g_male_waghand01" />No, he’s not! His mind has simply had to contend with<g id="g_litearmor_hopeless" /> so much. Centuries and centuries of memories.
We were<g id="g_litearmor_shrugbrief" /> never meant to live this long. Imhotep has said so on many occasions.
“Is he reliable?”
Of<g id="g_litearmor_agree1" /> course! He holds more knowledge than anyone else in the world.<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> We just have to be patient with him.

<g id="g_litearmor_gestureforwardrighthand" />There's an outpost that way called Cavalier's Rest. Please<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" />, search Carthago. Find Imhotep and bring him there.<g id="g_male_convince02" /> I've come to rely on you. Don't let me down.
<g id="g_female_clasphandsconvince" />Have you searched Carthago for any signs of Imhotep and Aban? We must find them!
Please… help me… aahhh… please…
“Easy… Are you Aban?”
My master Imhotep… gone to New Rhacotis… I was to collect Ghazi… meet him there… I didn’t see them… didn’t hear them…
“Didn’t hear who?”
Those things! *cough* Those horrible things… You must warn Imhotep… the sands… have come alive…
<g id="g_female_spreadarms" />You’ve returned! By Isis, you're tougher than old crocodile leather.<g id="g_male_headshakeno" /> But your look is so grim. I’m afraid to ask…
“No Imhotep, just a dying Aban.”
<g id="g_female_lookconcern" />Oh no, my poor, sweet Aban! What happened to him?<g id="g_female_gestureleftm" /> Did he say anything?
“He said the sands came alive.”
<g id="g_litearmor_handsonhipsshakeheads" bout="1.5" />What the hell does that mean?<g id="g_litearmor_takeitem5s" priority="high" /> And what’s this? Another journal page?
<g id="g_litearmor_worry" />Oh my dear master! What could’ve befallen him?<g id="g_female_smackfist" /> Damn my eyes, I should’ve been by his side!
Read the journal entry, 'The Malevolence Grows'
Continue following Imhotep's trail into {POITags}
Search Carthago for any signs of Imhotep
Locate the speaker in distress
Assault the Lost Bandits in Carthago:
Defeat {targetName}
Descend to the Carthago docks
Defeat {targetName}
Follow Aban's instructions and continue on toward {POITags}
Investigate the temple for signs of Imhotep

Search New Rhacotis for Imhotep's whereabouts

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ: A Blossoming Threat
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_litearmor_handsonhipsshakeheads" />I knew something had gone wrong! I’m cursed with an infallible instinct for these sorts of things.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ: A Blossoming Threat
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />Did you discover anything else in New Rhacotis?
A Blossoming Threat

With the ambush by the Angry Earth, Ghazi is certain they are responsible for Imhotep's disappearance. She knows the Angry Earth have been seen around Jupiter's Grove, and asks again for your continued help in finding Imhotep.\n\nGhazi's scouts have reported that you will need a ranged weapon to complete this task.
“The Angry Earth were there.”
<g id="g_litearmor_headtilthmm" />Angry Earth? They must have attacked Imhotep. I’ve never heard of them wandering that far.
<g id="g_litearmor_think" priority="high" />What could they have wanted? There are few Angry Earth here and they normally gather at Jupiter’s Grove.
“Sounds like I should go there.”
<g id="g_litearmor_complimentplayer" />Oh, I'm really developing an affection for you! Go and see what you can find.<g id="g_litearmor_willcoverit" /> I'll head to New Corsica to see what I can find.
<g id="g_litearmor_hopeless" />I feel terrible about sweet Aban's fate...
(Blank Space)
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />Well, you certainly seem to have stirred up this hornet’s nest, youngster!
<g id="g_female_nodshrugokay" />Sadly, I find myself a prisoner of these elemental beings or else I’d offer my assistance.
“I've been looking for you, Imhotep.”
Then this is a fortuitous day for us<g id="g_male_handheart" priority="high" /> both for I am he!
<g id="g_female_gesturedown" priority="high" />There’s a sandy monstrosity that seems to have a way to release these unusual bonds.<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" /> But I doubt it’ll simply hand it over.
<g id="g_male_compliment" bout="2" />Ah. Brilliantly done, youngster! I could tell by your show of martial prowess that you are highly trained.
<g id="g_male_pointblame" />Now, let me guess – Ghazi sent you. Am I right?
“Yes, she's headed to New Corsica.”
<g id="g_male_nodunderstand" />Remarkable woman! A brilliant mind for one so young.
<g id="g_male_shakehead" />But we mustn’t waste any time. Something evil stirs in the sands.<g id="g_female_nodyes" /> I’ll meet you both in New Corsica. There’s much to do!
<g id="g_female_spreadarms" />You made it! You're becoming as reliable as the dawn!
<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />Imhotep arrived a short while ago. He was quite impressed with his gallant rescuer.
“I was only following your lead.”

string.comment: May edit if we do turn-in in Library.
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_female_flirtsmall" />Oh, I could kiss your striking visage! Repeatedly! Thankfully Imhotep was still in one piece.
Search for Imhotep among the Angry Earth in {POITags} [Ranged Weapon Required]
Search for the captive Imhotep in {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and collect the {itemName} to free Imhotep
Return to Imhotep and free him
Destroy the exposed nodules of the driftwood cage with a ranged weapon
Seek out Ghazi and Imhotep in New Corsica

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ - Past Prologue
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_female_sympathyhandsheart" />Please excuse the mess. Most of the important books and scrolls in the city were seized and stored here.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ - Past Prologue
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: It’s become our library and our sanctum.
Past Prologue
While Imhotep recuperates from his recent tribulations, Ghazi has suggested you read Imhotep's 'Legacy of the Ancients' and learn of the impact the Ancients had on Brimstone Sands.
“Who seized the books?”
<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" />The Pontifex Charmion, a spiritual leader here for many years.<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" /> She was once very wise, but she’s lost her way.
<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" />Unfortunately, New Corsica has suffered under her guidance.<g id="g_female_leanpointconvince" /> Guard your words carefully in her presence.
“Where’s Imhotep?”
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />He’s recovering from his ordeal. Although relatively unharmed,<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" /> it had a greater impact on him than he was willing to say.
<g id="g_litearmor_converseleft" />He’s taking restorative elixirs to help him focus his mind.
“How did he seem to you?”
<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" />I’ve never seen him so troubled. Honestly, it scares me.

<g id="g_litearmor_realize" />Oh, he wanted you to consult a scroll. He said it would<g id="g_litearmor_converseleft" /> shed light on our current situation.<g id="g_litearmor_gestureright" priority="high" /> It’s just there on the table.
<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" />Have you looked at Imhotep’s scroll? I think you’ll find it illuminating.
Read the tome, 'Legacy of the Ancients'
Ah, my skilled and cunning rescuer! Ghazi has regaled me with accounts of your valorous deeds. I found them most engaging!
Have you read the scroll?
“I have so many questions.”
I would imagine so. But I’m afraid those must wait for now. There is grim work ahead and much to do!

string.comment: COMPLETE FOR PASTPROLOGUE - Ghazi to Imhotep - overhead shot
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_male_why" />I am NOT BEING LOUD! I'm simply worried about you-<g id="g_litearmor_whatwantfromme" /> think about Aban!

string.comment: Imhotep to Ghazi - 2shot feature player, profile Ghazi
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_male_righthandangry" />Do you think I could ever forget Aban?
"Is this a bad time?"

string.comment: Ghazi to Imhotep - 3 shot eye level, chair foreground bottom right
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_male_dismissgetlost1" />We’ll continue this later.
I have a feeling matters are about to get far more complicated.<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" /> And not in a good way. I certainly hope we're both ready.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ: Watering the Seed
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />As Ghazi noted, the Angry Earth has not<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" /> been a significant force here for hundreds of years.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ: Watering the Seed
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_youknow" />Their fearsome presence has multiplied by a significant factor recently. That never happens by chance.
Watering the Seed

Recovered from his kidnapping, the Great Sage Imhotep has told you of the strange seed carried north by the Angry Earth, likely to the Oasis Spontanea. He and Ghazi will await you at the Great Shrine of Thoth.

string.comment: CUE FOR WATERING SEED PROPOSAL - Ghazi to player
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_litearmor_complimentplayer" />Words fail me. How can I ever thank you for saving this old goat?

string.comment: Imhotep to player - 3 shot on Imhotep, in between ghazi and player backs
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_headnodding" />Yes, this "goat" owes you a tremendous debt. But I’m<g id="g_male_concerns" /> afraid we may not yet take our rest.
"You need me to find the Seed."

string.comment: WATERING PROPOSAL - Ghazi to Imhotep - 3 shot on ghazi, in between player and imhotep
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_female_youknows" />You see what I said about our friend here?
<g id="g_female_nodyes" />Indeed! Most impressive. Your presumption is correct; we must<g id="g_female_pointthreaten" /> retrieve the seed of the Azoth Tree.
It seems the Angry Earth have re-awakened just for the seed- but we must learn what they plan to do with it.
<g id="g_male_headnodyes" />And, where they've taken it.
"Probably to Oasis Spontanea."
<g id="g_male_think" priority="high" />Yes. Of course. To grow the seed, they'll need water, and plenty of it.<g id="g_female_nodding" /> Now I understand Ghazi’s embarrassing obsession with you.

string.comment: Ghazi to Imhotep - nice 2 shot on ghazi with player
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_male_pointblame" />Do remember, Imhotep, that I'm much more handy with a sword than you.

<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />Thank you for your help. I would join you, but I felt an evil presence on my journey, near the Shrine of Thoth.<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" /> One which Ghazi and I must investigate.
<g id="g_female_gestureleftm" />Recover the Seed if you can, and meet us at the Shrine.
“Why did they capture you?”
A most excellent question! It’s one I have no answer for… yet.
But while captive, I saw them take a seed from the Azoth tree and feed it vast quantities of life energy.
“They're growing an Azoth tree?”
An excellent guess. But why? I doubt it means something salubrious for humanity.
They carried the seed away to parts unknown. However, it will require a steady source of water. That’s rare in a desert…
“Is there an oasis nearby?”
Hmm? Oh, yes! Excellently reasoned! The Oasis Spontanea would provide such an aqueous bounty.
Go there and investigate. We will meet you at the Great Shrine of Thoth. Together, we will solve this conundrum!
<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" />Have you been to the Oasis Spontanea? We must discover what nefarious scheme the Angry Earth is seeding.

string.comment: Ghazi incomplete text during first half of 'Watering the Seed'
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: I've been to the Oasis Spontanea. It contains both<g id="g_male_converseright" /> beauty and danger. Out here, that particular combination is relatively common.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & TalkTo - Great Shrine of Thoth
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />I'll never forget your help in rescuing Imhotep. I’m in your debt.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & TalkTo - Great Shrine of Thoth
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_litearmor_worry" />Although Imhotep's putting on a brave face, I still have worries. He's a tough old buzzard but<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> even he has limits.
“How's his mind holding up?”
<g id="g_litearmor_shrugbrief" />It appears stable… for now.<g id="g_litearmor_converseleft" /> But I will watch him closely.

<g id="g_litearmor_handsonhipsshakeheads" priority="high" />Something's still amiss. And my instincts are rarely wrong, remember?<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> It can happen but it's as rare as an eclipse.
“I like your confidence.”

<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" />It gives me little comfort. Take Aban, for example. He’s not returned.<g id="g_female_headnodding" /> And I knew he wouldn't. Whatever killed him terrified him enough to prevent his resurrection.
<g id="g_litearmor_handheart" />I can’t imagine poor Aban as a Lost…
“You two were close?”
<g id="g_litearmor_willcoverit" />He was like a brother. I remember when he came to Imhotep, seeking to learn.<g id="g_male_nodsympathysmall" /> He seemed so frail.
<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />Imhotep turned him away, but I changed his mind. Aban had the soul of an explorer.<g id="g_male_headshakeno" /> I hope he can forgive me...
<g id="g_male_compliment" />Ah, there you are! No doubt you’ve witnessed all manner of fascinating events and faced innumerable perils.
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />And bearing gifts, I see! What is that device?
“It was feeding the seed pod.”
Feeding, you<g id="g_female_takeitem8s" priority="high" /> say? Most intriguing. This will certainly merit further study. Hmm, yes, most intriguing indeed…
Investigate the {POITags} for clues to the Angry Earth
Search the ruins for signs of the Angry Earth
Destroy the Angry Earth Power Sources:
East Ancient Pylon
North Ancient Pylon
Southwest Ancient Pylon
Collect the {itemName}
Meet Ghazi and Imhotep at the Shrine of Thoth

string.comment: Default Dialogue & gives MSQ: Unraveling the Mystery
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" />This device is of Ancient make. I recognize the distinctive markings and construction. It’s a focus for some kind of power.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & gives MSQ: Unraveling the Mystery
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_headshakesmall" />But I’ve never seen one exactly like this before.
<g id="g_litearmor_converseleft" />Imhotep knows many arcane spells and secrets. His mastery of Ancient magic is<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> unrivaled on Aeternum.
Unraveling the Mystery

Unable to breach the magic of the Ancient focus, Imhotep knows of a powerful spell which may provide answers. Relics from Aqua Anuket, Arit-en-Geb, and Anhur's Pride should empower his magic enough to succeed.
“You knew the Ancients.”
Oh, I knew them.<g id="g_male_nod2" bin="1" bout="1.5" /> Well enough to worry about a device like this.
<g id="g_female_explains" />It’s protected by an arcane lock that prevents me from discerning its nature.<g id="g_male_headnodyes" /> I’ve encountered such locks before.
“I’m guessing you can open it?”
<g id="g_female_spreadarms" />That remains to be seen. This one seems especially complex.<g id="g_female_tiltheadremember" priority="high" /> The design is familiar, though…
<g id="g_female_leanforwardlisten" />Fortunately, I happen to know a spell that can open Ancient locks. But I will require<g id="g_male_spreadhands" /> certain rare components.
“You have a list?”
<g id="g_male_nod2" />Hah! Your eagerness and acumen are commendable.<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" /> You remind me of Ghazi.
<g id="g_female_giveitem" priority="high" />Here is the list of components and where to acquire them.<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" /> I’d warn you of the danger, but I believe you’re up to the task.
<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" />Have you collected the components I need to unlock the Ancient device?
<g id="g_female_takeandgiveitem5s" priority="high" />These items are fine specimens. You have an eye for this sort of work, youngster.
<g id="g_female_gestureforward01" />Place the items in the conjuring circle in the areas I’ve marked. Then for your safety,<g id="g_male_converseleft" /> step away. I shall begin the incantation.
“Is this Ancient magic?”
<g id="g_female_nodyes" />It is indeed. A sorcery taught to me by one of the Ancients themselves. My mentor.

<g id="g_female_explains" />It isn’t what we thought, by the way. The Ancients.<g id="g_male_waghand03" /> They were not gods. Though they<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" /> wielded power as if they were.
“What were they like?”
<g id="g_male_dontknow" bout="2" />Too much like us in some ways. And yet not enough like us in others.<g id="g_male_headshakeno" /> The specter of Aeternum is their legacy. Never forget that.
<g id="g_male_itsokay" />But now I must concentrate. Stay close to Ghazi.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & TalkTo - Great Shrine of Thoth
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_litearmor_converseright" />You may witness all manner of sanity-bending events in Imhotep's presence.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & TalkTo - Great Shrine of Thoth
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />He knows ancient secrets and magics that have not been witnessed by anyone for millennia.
“I'm not easily rattled.”
<g id="g_litearmor_complimentplayer" />Yes, I noticed. You're as solid as the firmament. And I thank Isis for that.
Imhotep! I have been freed from the sands! Our masters grant us their power! The Ancient fires will be rekindled!
You will wither! Your flesh food for worms! Ravenous Death will have her feast! Hahaha!
Imhotep! I have been freed from the sands! Our masters grant us their power! The Ancient fires will be rekindled!
You will wither! Your flesh food for worms! Ravenous Death will have her feast! Hahaha!

string.comment: Default Dialogue & TalkTo - Great Shrine of Thoth
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_female_clenchfistssuffer" />Oh gods, it’s happened! Just as I feared it would! His state of mind was far more fragile than he had let on. My poor master…
“What’s going on, Ghazi?”
<g id="g_female_handsonhipsshakeheads" />Imhotep's mind has shifted. The gentle soul of the Great Sage is gone.<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> Another has arisen in his place…
“He’s the ‘Great Pharaoh’ now?”
<g id="g_male_headnodyes" />Yes, we stand in the presence of the Great Pharaoh Imhotep, Son of Ptah, High Priest of Heliopolis.
We must speak to him accordingly.<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" /> We must not stress him further.
No, this cannot be! The demon has been unleashed. After all these centuries...
The nightmare takes shape once again. This will be our doom!
“What was that thing?”
“Imhotep, are you alright?”
Address me as ‘Great Pharaoh.’ That demon is Apophis, and his presence proves our dilemma is most dire.
You will defeat this nightmare. I appoint you to this task. You will become my Sword.

string.comment: multi_01 - imhotep to himself - Low angle on Imhotep piece of player arm
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_male_shocked" />No! It cannot be- we have unleashed the demon!

string.comment: multi_02 - ghazi to imhotep - 3-shot with ghazi OTS of player, facing player back
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_female_lookaroundshifty" priority="high" />But that's impossible- for it to re-awaken after all these centuries!<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" /> Was it the ritual?

string.comment: multi_03 - imhotep to ghazi - 3-shot with ghazi OTS of player, facing player back
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_male_clenchfistsangry" />Yes! Swaddled in arrogance, I have<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" /> brought doom upon us all!
"It isn't your fault-"

string.comment: multi_05 - imhotep to ghazi, then to himself -- CUP Ghazi with piece of Imhotep in shot from his right side
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_male_noway" priority="high" />No, no! No, NO! I must do something. I must stop him!<g id="g_male_clutchheadcrouch" /> Ahh! My mind darkens. I drown in shadows! I am lost.<g id="g_male_clutchheadcrouch" /> Lost! ARGH!
<g id="g_female_lookconcern" />Imhotep!
"Is he all right?"

string.comment: multi_08 - imhotep to player- 3shot Top down, on Imhotep from right side of player, on Ghazi's back
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: Address me as ‘Great Pharaoh.’<g id="g_female_pointthreaten" bin="2" bout="2" /> I appoint you as my Sword to defeat Apophis, our eternal foe.

Accursed Apophis

Apophis's remarks have Imhotep worried about a grander machination involving Ancient technology. He suggests investigating an undisturbed Ancient vault in Hermopolis, where Apophis may have found materials for his plans, while he and Ghazi return to New Corsica.
Apophis is a Primordial, one of the powerful elders of the Angry Earth. I had believed him banished long ago.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ: Accursed Alchemy
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: His return can only mean destruction. Possibly even another Great Purge.
“That sounds ominous.”
Millennia ago, Apophis led the Angry Earth in a campaign of genocide against my people.
Only because they ceased their attacks and returned to the earth. What power compelled their retreat is unknown.
But the demon has returned, spewing disturbing words of rekindling the Ancient fires.
“What does that mean?”
It could mean calamity but we must know for certain. We may find answers in an Ancient vault in Hermopolis.
You must find a way to access it. I do not have that knowledge. When done, meet us in New Corsica.

string.comment: multi_09 - imhotep to player - LA on imhotep with player arm in fg
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" bin="2" bout="2"/>Apophis is a Primordial, an elder of the Angry Earth we believed banished. His return heralds the destruction of humanity.
"Nothing too important, then."

string.comment: multi_11 - imhotep to player - 3shot of imhotep, ghazi, player, imhotep in profile
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_male_converseright" bin="2" bout="2"/>The Ancients awakened the Angry Earth to battle Corruption.<g id="g_female_fingerwagno" bin="2" bout="2"/> But their deadly weapon perceived us as a threat as well.

string.comment: multi_12 - ghazi to player - 3shot of imhotep, ghazi, player, imhotep in profile
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_female_youknow" />It was millenia ago, but the horror is still fresh. Apophis led the Angry Earth<g id="g_female_disappointed" /> in a war of genocide against our people.
“Glad to see it failed.”

string.comment: multi_14 - on ghazi, 2-shot with player mostly in profile from player left side
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_female_shrugnothingicando" />Only because they ceased their attacks and returned to the earth. We never discovered why.
“What did it mean, Ancient Fires?”

string.comment: multi_16 - MCU Imhotep, slightly low angle off player shoulder
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_male_headshakeno" bin="2" bout="2" />I know not. But there is a vault in Hermopolis, where many records were kept.<g id="g_male_pointsoutthere" /> Seek, my Sword, and meet us anon in New Corsica.
<g id="g_female_gestureleftm" />Go to Hermopolis and find a way to access the Ancient vault. We must discover Apophis’s plan before it’s too late.
<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />We must attend to the words of the Great Pharaoh.<g id="g_litearmor_converseleft" /> I know he seems different, but he's still Imhotep and wise beyond measure.
<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" />Being named the Great Pharaoh's Sword is an immense honor.<g id="g_female_youknows" /> He seems to have complete confidence in you.
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />If we are careful and make use of his will and determination, we may yet prevail here.
“I won't let him down.”
<g id="g_litearmor_converseright" />I know the vault the Great Pharaoh speaks of, but I've<g id="g_litearmor_shrugbrief" /> never ventured there myself.
<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" />It’s a cursed place filled with dark secrets and the specters of a violent past.
“You sure Imhotep’s okay?”
<g id="g_litearmor_agree1" />The Great Pharaoh may seem different, but he’s still Imhotep the Wise.<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> He and Apophis were enemies, which makes us his allies.
<g id="g_female_leanpointconvince" />Stay safe, and I'll see you in New Corsica.

<g id="g_male_spreadarms001" />My mighty Sword returns! You shine with the light of Ra. What<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" /> mysteries have you uncovered in the vault?<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> Speak to your pharaoh!
“Some scrolls and this thing.”
<g id="g_female_takeitem8s" priority="high" />Hmm. These scrolls are written in Ancient script. There are few in Aeternum who can read them. I am one of them.
<g id="g_female_takeitem5s" priority="high" />And that strange jar. Something floats within…
“It’s a hand.”
<g id="g_male_nodunderstand" />So it is. I must decipher these scrolls.<g id="g_male_concerns" /> There is foul alchemy at work here.
Search the ruins of {POITags} for the Entrance to the Ancient Vault
Investigate the Ancient architecture for the Entrance to the Ancient Vault
Continue searching for any clues about the Ancient Vault
Input the correct glyph sequence, then use the Actuator

Collect {itemName} for Imhotep to translate
Take the strange {itemName}
Meet Ghazi and Imhotep at the Library in New Corsica
<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" />The Great Pharaoh is relying on you. Oh, who am I kidding?<g id="g_litearmor_hopeless" /> I'm relying on you.
<g id="g_litearmor_complimentplayer" />I don’t think we could’ve chosen a better champion.<g id="g_litearmor_headtilthmm" /> That's not too much pressure, is it?

string.comment: Default Dialogue - New Corsica (2) & gives MSQ: The Demon's Cauldron
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />The scrolls speak of a process that combines the bodies and souls of different creatures together into a chimera.

string.comment: Default Dialogue - New Corsica (2) & gives MSQ: The Demon's Cauldron
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: This is the blasphemous power that the Ancients used to create the Primordials.
<g id="g_male_headshakeno" />The Pools of Orcus are a foul place. The fumes there sicken even the heartiest of individuals.
<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" />Tread carefully, Sword of Imhotep. The less time spent there, the better.
The Demon's Cauldron

Imhotep's translation speaks of a method to merge two beings together, a practice thought long lost. The sulfurous jar indicates a visit to the Pools of Orcus to the west, and he asks your help in searching for clues to Apophis's plans.
“Someone’s making Primordials?”
<g id="g_male_shakehead" />I did not think it possible. But perhaps I was mistaken.
<g id="g_female_youknow" />This strange jar is not centuries old, it’s new.<g id="g_male_headshakeno" /> Someone recently visited the vault.
“Apophis?”
<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" />I do not think so. Such craft seems beyond that demon’s temperament and skill.
<g id="g_female_leanpointconvince" />There’s another mind at work here. One that is far more cunning.
“Command your Sword, Pharaoh.”
<g id="g_male_rememberbig" />I recognize the pungent scent and sickly color of the jar’s fluid. It comes from the sulfurous Pools of Orcus.
<g id="g_male_converseleft" />Go there and see what you can discover. But<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" /> be on your guard. A great evil lurks in the shadows.
<g id="g_female_gestureleftm" />Have you been to the Pools of Orcus? We must know what manner of abomination Apophis is creating.
<g id="g_litearmor_secretiveshort" />The Pools of Orcus are a foul place.<g id="g_litearmor_converseleft" /> The fumes there sicken even the heartiest of individuals.
<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" />Tread carefully, Sword of Imhotep.<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" /> The less time spent there, the better.
“How’s Imhotep holding up?”
<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" />Honestly, I’m worried. I’ve made more elixir, which helps to control his affliction.
<g id="g_litearmor_worry" />I fear Imhotep's formula is not strong enough. I could potentially devise a new one but<g id="g_female_shrugshort" /> my alchemy skills are not the equal of his.
“I have faith in you, Ghazi.”

<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />And I have faith in you. You remind me of someone<g id="g_litearmor_headtilthmm" /> I knew, long ago. Another brave and noble soul.<g id="g_litearmor_converseright" /> Together, we will win the day.
<g id="g_litearmor_complimentplayer" />Is there no task that you cannot accomplish? Ptah has crafted me a very fine weapon indeed.
<g id="g_litearmor_headtilthmm" />But I sense something strange, a familiar power…
“It’s probably this fragment.”
<g id="g_litearmor_takeitem5s" priority="high" />It’s a piece of a Disk of Atum! It pulses with quintessence, a potent energy from the stars the Ancients used in their magics.
<g id="g_male_headshakeno" />Why was this at the Pools of Orcus?
“There were monsters there.”
<g id="g_litearmor_handshipsconsider" />Could Apophis simply be creating an army of chimeras? That would take time. And it seems too simple a stratagem.
<g id="g_male_dontknows" />There is more here that we are not seeing.
Seek out the source of the sulfurous fluid in the {POITags}
Search for clues near the bubbling pools
Continue searching the pools for anything out of place
Search the remaining pools for any evidence of Apophis' involvement
Use the Azoth Staff to drain the barrier's energy
Destroy the crystal core
Collect an {itemName} from the rubble
Return to the Library to report on your findings
<g id="g_litearmor_hopeless" />This mystery becomes more frightening with every step.
<g id="g_female_spreadarms" />I can't imagine where it's leading us, but my instinct tells me it's a terrifying place.

string.comment: Gives MSQ: Power of the Gods
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_litearmor_converseleft" /> The Disks of Atum were used to focus the quintessence harnessed by the Ennead,<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> a vast power source housed within the Great Pyramid of Akhet.

string.comment: Gives MSQ: Power of the Gods
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_headnodding" />A structure I built for the Ancients long ago.
Power of the Ancients

Imhotep is intimately familiar with the fragment of the Ancient power source, having designed the Pyramid of Akhet to house it. He suggests searching near Diospolis for an entry point to the pyramid's interior, the origin of the fragment.
“What does it do?”
<g id="g_female_gestureleftm" />When active, it powered the Ancients’ great machines throughout the island.<g id="g_female_tiltheadremember" /> Hm. Apophis did boast he had been granted power.
<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" />Akhet houses both wonders and horrors. It has weapons capable of terrible devastation.
“Maybe he’s after those.”
<g id="g_male_think" />They would certainly suit that demon’s lust for destruction. And it's clear he’s been to the pyramid.
<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" />My Sword must investigate Akhet to determine if the flow of quintessence has increased.
“How will I do that, Pharaoh?”
<g id="g_female_gestureleftm" />I’ll enhance your Azoth Staff to detect the precious energy.
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />Seek out the Diospolis entrance to the pyramid. It’ll give you the access to the inner workings of the temple, to its deepest secrets. Go with the light of Ra!
<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" />Find your way into Akhet via the Diospolis entrance. We must know what Apophis intends to do with the Ennead’s power.
<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" />So you intend to enter Akhet? Imhotep built the great pyramid.
<g id="g_litearmor_concerns" />Whatever happened there, it was enough to ensure he would never return. The Corrupted Legion seeks to claim its power.
“Why am I not surprised?”
<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" />Many have coveted the Ennead's dangerous power over the centuries. And they’ve been punished as a result.
<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" />Please be careful in there.

I'm not sure why you've come here. You cannot stop what I have begun.

The threat of Corruption was dire, but the toll you exacted from the Motherwell, the damage you wrought... it will take generations to heal.

I foolishly came to the aid of humanity, and once again, this is how we were repaid.

It is proven again, Humanity is the true source of all evils, a vessel for Corruption, a plague to nature, and you are a prime example.

Another of my kind lies dreaming in these sands, but he will soon be awakened.

And together, we will purge this island of your kind and restore Aeternum to the paradise it was meant to be. Begone from here. There is nothing you can do.

string.comment: Broken out for subtitles from Akhet_Adiana line
string.speaker: Adiana
string.name: AdianaTheron

resources.string: I'm not sure why you've come here. You cannot stop what I have begun.

string.comment: Broken out for subtitles from Akhet_Adiana line
string.speaker: Adiana
string.name: AdianaTheron

resources.string: The threat of Corruption was dire, but the toll you exacted from the Motherwell, the damage you wrought...\nit will take generations to heal.

string.comment: Broken out for subtitles from Akhet_Adiana line
string.speaker: Adiana
string.name: AdianaTheron

resources.string: I foolishly came to the aid of humanity, and once again, this is how we were repaid.

string.comment: Broken out for subtitles from Akhet_Adiana line
string.speaker: Adiana
string.name: AdianaTheron

resources.string: It is proven again, Humanity is the true source of all evils, a vessel for Corruption,\na plague to nature, and you are a prime example.

string.comment: Broken out for subtitles from Akhet_Adiana line
string.speaker: Adiana
string.name: AdianaTheron

resources.string: Another of my kind lies dreaming in these sands, but he will soon be awakened.

string.comment: Broken out for subtitles from Akhet_Adiana line
string.speaker: Adiana
