resources.string: And together, we will purge this island of your kind and restore Aeternum to the paradise it was meant to be.

string.comment: Broken out for subtitles from Akhet_Adiana line
string.speaker: Adiana
string.name: AdianaTheron

resources.string: Begone from here. There is nothing you can do.
<g id="g_female_crossarms" />I'm not sure why you've come here. You cannot stop what I have begun.
<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" />The threat of Corruption was dire,<g id="g_female_yourecrazy" /> but the toll you exacted from the Motherwell, the damage you wrought… it will take generations to heal.
"I did what was necessary."
<g id="g_male_willcoverit" />I foolishly came to the aid of humanity, and once again,<g id="g_male_hopeless" /> this is how we were repaid.

<g id="g_female_leanpointconvince" />It is proven again, Humanity is the true source of all evils, a vessel for Corruption, a plague<g id="g_female_leanforwardsmall" /> to nature, and you are a prime example.
"So you're plotting revenge?"

<g id="g_female_gesturearoundroom" priority="high" />Another of my kind lies dreaming in these sands, but he will soon be awakened. And together,<g id="g_male_clenchfistsgetpumped02" /> we will purge this island of your kind and<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> restore Aeternum to the paradise it was meant to be.
<g id="g_female_dismissregal" />Begone from here. There is nothing you can do.
<g id="g_female_explains" />Even here, I sensed the surge of power from Akhet!<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" /> The earth hums with the energized blood flowing through her veins.
<g id="g_male_headshakeno" />What has Apophis done?
“It wasn’t Apophis, it was Adiana.”
<g id="g_female_tiltheadremember" />Adiana...? It has been many long centuries since I heard that name. I thought her gone, like the others.
<g id="g_female_explains" />You do realize she assumes that name only to masquerade in human<g id="g_male_pointblame" /> form? She is an Ancient we knew as Artemis.
"Adiana is an Ancient? Artemis?"
<g id="g_female_nodconsider" />Ah, so she keeps that a secret these days, does she?<g id="g_male_handshipsconsider" /> There is much significance to that fact, much I will need to consider.
<g id="g_female_gestureleftm" />But if she has reactivated the Ennead, then she has something quite catastrophic in mind.
“She's also awakening another?"
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />Here? In Brimstone Sands? She could only mean… Sutekh, the very Ancient who taught me the mysteries of Aeternum.
<g id="g_male_spreadhands" />My... master will return then! But Artemis will need the Eye of Horus…<g id="g_male_wavehandsnobig" /> only the Eye can awaken my master…
Search for the Diospolis entrance to the Pyramid of Akhet
Enter the Pyramid of Akhet
Defeat the {targetName} in the depths of the Pyramid
Climb the broken staircase to the upper level of the Pyramid
Search for the disturbance on the upper terrace
Listen to Adiana
Use Your Azoth Staff to unseal the Glyph
Read the Ancient Glyph "AMBA"
<g id="g_female_gestureleftm" />I must find the Eye of Horus… yes, the Eye is the key… yes, that is the only way…

string.comment: Gives MSQ: Scourge of Aeon Madness
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" />The revelation of Sutekh's return has pushed Imhotep's mind to the edge! If we lose him, we are truly doomed!
Scourge of Aeon Madness

Adiana's revelation at the pyramid has caused Imhotep's Aeon Madness to assert itself, and Ghazi has asked for help in gathering local herbs needed to treat the Great Sage. She will attempt to calm Imhotep while you prepare the recipe.
“What happened to his elixir?”
<g id="g_female_spreadarms" />I devised a more potent formula but I’ve run out of the materials to create it.
<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" />I don't even know if it'll work. But I can't leave his side. Not now!
“Give me the list, Ghazi.”
<g id="g_litearmor_itemgiveright" />I have it here, along with the formula!
<g id="g_litearmor_pleadhandsopen" />Please prepare it and return as quickly as possible. I’ll try and keep Imhotep calm.<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" /> I can see he’s barely hanging on.
<g id="g_male_why" />Imhotep's mind teeters on the edge! We need the improved elixir to heal him!
“How do we fight gods, Ghazi?”
<g id="g_female_spreadarms" />Imhotep says the Ancients are not gods! Not in the sense that we think of them, anyway.
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />But I share your concern, for there is no doubt they wield power like gods.
<g id="g_female_leanbackdrugged" />When he returns, we will suffer his wrath!<g id="g_male_wavehandsnobig" /> He will punish us!<g id="g_male_noway" /> I must intercede! I must save the people!
“Your Sword is here, Pharaoh.”
<g id="g_male_spreadhands" />I am no pharaoh! I am the Keeper of Mysteries, Guardian of Secrets, Steward of Dreams!
<g id="g_female_explains" />I obey the masters in all things… I am but a humble servant...
“I see…”
<g id="g_male_nodproud" />The Lord of the Red Land will awaken… His wisdom and power are vast…
<g id="g_female_sympathyhandsheart" />This need not be our ruin… this could this be our salvation!
<g id="g_litearmor_concerns" />Oh great Osiris! Imhotep is gone!
“What do you mean gone?”
<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />He started ranting about saving us! He raced out the door! I couldn’t stop him!
<g id="g_female_notsure" />I was going to go after him but I knew it was wiser to wait for your<g id="g_litearmor_hopeless" /> return. I'm no warrior.
Gather the ingredients to create Imhotep's Remedy
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}s north of New Corsica
Gather {itemName}s from the {POITags}
Search chests in {POITags} for {itemName}
Gather {itemName} from Cacti throughout Brimstone Sands
Craft Imhotep's Remedy at an Arcane Repository or Campsite
<g id="g_male_why" />Imhotep’s obsessed with Sutekh’s return! He kept insisting he had to "prepare the way!"
<g id="g_female_shrugnothingicando" />I’ve never seen him like this! He called himself<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> the “Vizier of the Ancients!”
The Eye of Horus
Ghazi's concern at Imhotep's flight is evident, and she begs your assistance in chasing him down. He ran toward the Gates of Sutekh, ranting about the Eye of Horus and the return of the gods.
“You did the right thing.
<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" />He must be headed to the Gates of Sutekh. They lie to the west.
<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" />Many believe that site to be both cursed and sacred. Imhotep's looking for the Eye of Horus.
“What is this Eye?”
<g id="g_litearmor_converseleft" />I’ve never seen it, but Imhotep’s mentioned it a few times.
<g id="g_litearmor_headtilthmm" />It’s a key of some kind. Whatever it is, if<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> Imhotep wants it so badly, it’s vital that we find it first!
“What if Imhotep is too far gone?”
<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />You have the new elixir! Perhaps it can soothe Imhotep’s raging mind.
<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" />Whatever happens, please remember that the good, gentle man is still there.<g id="g_male_why" /> You just have to find him again!
<g id="g_litearmor_pleadhandsopen" /> Go to the Gates of Sutekh. Imhotep is there searching for the Eye of Horus. You must find it before he does!
Retrieve the Eye of Horus! Use your staff! Track its potent quintessence!
“Imhotep?”
I’m with you… I’ll guide you if I can… Go, quickly!
Follow Imhotep to the {POITags}
Investigate the strange energy source on the wall
Adjust the position of the projector
Rotate the reflectors to project the beam of Azoth forward
Investigate the building indicated by the beam
Pass through the Ancient Glyph door and explore the sealed chamber
(The chest is empty. The Eye of Horus is gone.)
Challenging the Pharaoh
The Eye of Horus has been taken, but droplets of quintessence form a path to follow. Imhotep, or perhaps something worse, must be at the end of the trail.
You are making a grave mistake! You do not understand what is happening here! Leave now and pray for Sutekh’s mercy!
You are making a grave mistake! You do not understand what is happening here!
Leave now and pray for Sutekh’s mercy!
I do not wish to hurt you! Abandon this course of action! I will stop you if I must!
I was mistaken! The Ancients are gods! We must appeal to their benevolence! Go back!
Ghazi needs you! Return and protect her! She is far more than she seems! I beg you to see reason!
This is your last warning! I will unleash the fury of the Ancients! Don’t force my hand! I beg you!
Witness the power of the Ancients! Feel their wrath!
I am the Keeper of Mysteries! Guardian of Secrets!
Even you cannot stand against the Ancients! Stop fighting me!
End this pointless battle! Join me! You can aid my efforts to appease the gods!
Aeternum belongs to the Ancients! Let them reclaim it! It has been nothing but a curse on our people!

string.comment: Default Dialogue & TalkTo - Place of Pillars (after combat)
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_leanbackdrugged" />I am lost in<g id="g_male_clutchhead02" /> darkness... The abyss swallows me…
“Here, drink this!”
<g id="g_male_chuckle" />*cough* Ah, thank the Powers it’s you.<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" /> Please forgive me. I was not myself.
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />Ra’s Light, this elixir is most potent. And tastes<g id="g_female_headnodding" /> wonderfully of cinnamon. Well done!
“I need the Eye of Horus, Imhotep.”
<g id="g_male_itemgiveright" />Oh. Here, take it. It's the key to unlocking Sutekh’s Necropolis.<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> We must hope he's not yet been reawakened.
<g id="g_female_explains" />You will also need a code to enter the Necropolis. Place the Eye on the<g id="g_female_gestureleftm" /> pedestal further on. It will reveal the code.
<g id="g_male_compliment" />You have the code! Excellent! Ghazi’s faith in you is not misplaced.<g id="g_female_nodyes" /> Her instincts are never wrong.
<g id="g_female_handsonhipsshakeheads" />I wish she could see how she would benefit the people of New Corsica.<g id="g_male_spreadhands" /> She must stop hiding.
“What do you mean hiding?”
<g id="g_male_waghand02" />Nothing to be concerned over. You have far more important matters to worry about at the moment.
Use the Azoth Staff to follow Imhotep's trail
Follow Imhotep into the {POITags}
Search for a path up the pillars to reach Imhotep
Ascend the ruins to confront Imhotep
Confront Imhotep
Assist Imhotep with his injuries
Use the Eye of Horus on the Ancient Code Pillar
Read the journal entry, 'The Book of Gates'
<g id="g_female_giveitem" />Now that you have the code and the Eye, here is the location of Sutekh’s Necropolis.
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />It was hidden long ago to ensure the slumbering Ancient would not be disturbed.
A God Awakens

With the Eye of Horus in hand, Imhotep has given you the location of the Necropolis of Sutekh, the resting place of an Ancient. Adiana and Apophis must not be allowed to rouse Sutekh from his slumber!
“What happens if he wakes up?”
<g id="g_female_pointthreaten" />That must not happen! You must prevent Sutekh’s return at all costs!
<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" />But be prepared for a great battle. Apophis may already be there,<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> and that monster’s power is terrifying.
“Are you going to be alright?”
<g id="g_male_spreadhands" />I will be fine. Thanks to you, my dear friend.

<g id="g_male_spreadarmscalm" />Please come back to us. Ghazi and I have become quite fond of your striking visage.<g id="g_male_hopeless" /> And she would be most distraught to lose another loved one.
<g id="g_male_pointblame" />You must stop Apophis from awakening Sutekh! An Ancient of his power would wreak havoc on this land!
Insignificant worm! Does the presence of the master fill you with dread? With awe? His return is inevitable!
Your kind should never have had the power of Azoth! You corrupted what was once pure!
I hunger for destruction! But my appetite pales in comparison to humanity's gluttony!
We have suffered your presence long enough! Die, worm! Be buried by the sands! Hahaha!
My master will awaken soon! You will bear witness! Prepare to face judgement! Kneel, worm!
Impossible! Argh! You are nothing! The masters will return! They will revoke their gifts! You will wither…

string.comment: Default Dialogue - Necropolis of Sutekh & TalkTo after combat, 'A God Awakens'
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_male_clenchfistright" />Yes! Blessed be the Light of Ra! I sensed the<g id="g_male_nodmild" /> foul presence of Apophis banished to the sands!

string.comment: Default Dialogue - Necropolis of Sutekh & TalkTo after combat, 'A God Awakens'
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />I was hoping I would not have to confront the demon myself.
“You doubted your Sword?”
<g id="g_male_shrugbrief" />I was cautiously optimistic. And<g id="g_male_compliment" /> you are not my sword, you are the Sword of Brimstone Sands!
<g id="g_female_youknows" />Please return to New Corsica. Ghazi will be<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> worried sick and will be delighted to see you.
“To see us, you mean.”
<g id="g_male_shrugbrief" />She’s spent far too many years looking at this weary, old face.<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> It’s you she will be eager to see.
<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" />And I will be glad to see the two of you reunited.
<g id="g_female_spreadarms" />Bring your beautiful visage here and let me gaze upon you for a few moments!<g id="g_female_headnodding" /> It is so good to see you.
“You’ll make me blush.”
<g id="g_female_flirtsmall" />The flush of color would suit you. I knew you would do it.<g id="g_female_spreadarms" /> My instincts are never wrong, remember?
“It’s good to see you, too, Ghazi.”
<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" />I hope we’ll be seeing much more of each other.<g id="g_male_sighrelief" /> Under far less nerve-wracking circumstances.
<g id="g_male_compliment" />Ah. The Sword of Brimstone returns! You have defeated a mighty demon and brought order to this land.
<g id="g_male_spreadhands" />I will be forever grateful for the great service you have done for my people.
“What should I call you?”
Hmm. A fair question.<g id="g_female_explains" /> I am now a reflection of all my past lives. But<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" /> they are in balance, thanks to your tasty elixir.
<g id="g_male_lookupsmall" />If I am to choose a title, then I choose Imhotep the Physician,<g id="g_male_pointblame" /> for the time has come to heal the land.
Enter the Ordeal of the Nine Gates
Complete the Ordeal of the Nine Gates
Enter the Necropolis of Sutekh and face Apophis
Defeat Apophis and prevent him from awakening Sutekh
Return to Imhotep to report your success
Return to the Library in New Corsica
<g id="g_litearmor_shrugbrief" />I don’t know about you, but I could use a hot bath and a nice long nap.<g id="g_female_flirtsmall" /> Some company would be nice as well…

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ: Secret in the Desert
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_clasphandsrequest" />I’m afraid I must ask you for one final boon. Given what you’ve done,<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" /> I feel almost selfish making this request.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & Gives MSQ: Secret in the Desert
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_male_spreadhands" />But I would trust only you to undertake this most important task.
Secret in the Desert
With Apophis no longer a threat, Imhotep has turned his attention to matters closer to home. He has asked assistance in recovering a precious and mysterious parcel, buried long ago.
“I’ll help if I can.”
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />There is a parcel I wish recovered. You may find it buried to the south,<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> near a place sacred to Sobek.
<g id="g_female_nodconsider" />This parcel is very precious to me. I beg you to guard it closely.
“Sounds mysterious.”
Ah…<g id="g_male_shrugbrief" /> It could decide the<g id="g_female_gesturearoundroom" /> future of New Corsica and affect the direction of all of Brimstone Sands.
<g id="g_female_explains" />When you return with it, I shall reveal what it contains and explain everything.
<g id="g_male_leanforwardinspect" />Have you acquired my parcel? It contains something of great value to<g id="g_male_converseleft" /> all of Brimstone. Please retrieve it.

string.comment: KILL TALK TO - Default Dialogue - Necropolis of Sutekh & TalkTo after combat, 'A God Awakens'
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: Ah, the precious parcel. I knew I would need this again someday. And now you deserve to see what it contains.
“Fancy clothes?”
Robes of state. This is the raiment of a noble ruler from a great land. There is so much history in these threads and these jewels.
“They don’t really seem like you.”
Hah! No, they are not. Could you return them to their owner? To Ghazi.

string.comment: Imhotep to player - CUP OTS Imhotep over player left shoulder - for give item
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_takeitem5s" priority="high" />Ah, our precious parcel. Thank you. I knew we would need this someday.

string.comment: Ghazi to Imhotep - 3 shot eye level, chair foreground bottom right
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" />Imhotep! You told me they were destroyed!
"Nothing good inside, I take it."

string.comment: Imhotep to Ghazi - 3 shot eye level, chair foreground bottom right
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_male_laughcocky" />Ha! Good or not, depends largely on the<g id="g_female_nodyes" /> owner. And her heart.

string.comment: Ghazi to player - nice 2 shot ghazi with player
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_female_shakeheadno" />They are robes of state. For someone long gone- and<g id="g_litearmor_agree1" /> we are better off for it.

string.comment: Imhotep to Ghazi 3 shot eye level
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_notsure" />Our people need Cleopatra, now more than ever.
"Cleopatra? As in Queen Cleopatra?"

string.comment: Imhotep to player - 2 shot on imhotep with player to rt of ghazi
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_gestureforward02" />Yes, our dear Ghazi is indeed Cleopatra, Queen of Egypt.

string.comment: Ghazi to player - nice 2 shot ghazi with player
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_male_pointblame" />But a wiser woman took her place.

string.comment: Ghazi to Imhotep - - MCU Ghazi, 2 shot OTS over imhotep left shoulder
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: One with<g id="g_male_why" /> no desire to lead. And New Corsica has Evandrus now.

string.comment: Imhotep to Ghazi - 3 shot eye level
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_explains" />Evandrus means well, but he lacks experience. He needs your wisdom.
“Why don’t I go ask him?”

string.comment: Imhotep to player - 2 shot on imhotep with player to rt of ghazi
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_headnodding" />An excellent suggestion! Speak with Evandrus. See what he<g id="g_male_spreadhands" /> thinks of Queen Cleopatra’s return.

string.comment: Imhotep to Ghazi - wide 3 shot on imhotep, ghazi and player backs
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_gesturerightm" />Assuming she consents.
“Your Highness?”

string.comment: Ghazi to player - 3 shot eye level chair fg
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_female_spreadarms" />If both you and Imhotep feel it's for the best- I will consider it.

string.comment: Ghazi to Imhotep 3 shot eye level chair fg
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_female_pointthreaten" />But that's the most I'll promise!
Perhaps we’ll get a proper library now— what’s this? Where did you get this?
“Imhotep sent me to find it.”
I never thought I’d look upon this again… Oh, Isis, why do you punish me so?
“Imhotep said it was yours.”
Imhotep! You swore a vow! Before all the gods! You oath-breaking, old goat!
Search for the strange parcel buried at the {POITags}
Retrieve the parcel for Imhotep

string.comment: Not being used. This line is cut.
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_shrugdontcare" />I vowed I would never speak your name openly. And I have not broken that vow.

string.comment: Not being used. This line is cut.
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_gestureleftm" />This noble soul deserves to know the truth. After all we’ve gone through together.<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> I know you believe that.

string.comment: this is the old lead-in to queen revealed quest
string.speaker: Ghazi Laghmani
string.name: GhaziLaghmani

resources.string: <g id="g_female_headshakesmall" />I’m sorry, I should have told you sooner. I wanted to. But I’ve been Ghazi for so long…
<g id="g_litearmor_converseleft" />My actual name, the one I was given at birth, is Cleopatra.
A Queen Revealed

Ghazi's true identity has been revealed - Cleopatra VII Thea Philopater, Queen of Egypt! Her return would bring hope to the people of New Corsica, but Evandrus may have other ideas. Speak with him to determine his feelings.
“What is happening here?”
I’m sorry, I should have told you sooner. I wanted to. But I’ve been Ghazi for so long…
My actual name, the one I was given at birth, is Cleopatra.
“As in Queen Cleopatra of Egypt?”
Yes, but she died long ago. And another woman took her place. A better woman, wiser, stronger, more gentle.
Besides, New Corsica has Evandrus now. The people have no need of a queen.
“Why don't I go ask Evandrus?”
No, she's being stubborn! Ghazi, it is time for you to take up the mantle of leadership and guide your people once again.
Evandrus means well, but he’s young and inexperienced. He’ll need your wisdom and infallible instincts.
“Why don’t I go ask him?”
Another excellent suggestion! Go and speak with Evandrus. See what he thinks of Queen Cleopatra’s return. Assuming she consents.
“Your Highness?”
If both you and Imhotep feel this is for the best, then go. I will consider your words, though they weigh heavy on my heart.
<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" />Have you spoken to Evandrus about Queen Cleopatra’s return?<g id="g_female_explains" /> His opinion is vital to swaying Ghazi.
<g id="g_female_nodshrugokay" />I am still pondering your words. There is so much to consider.<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" /> I thought I had escaped the past.
Hail, Hero of New Corsica! Always good to see you.
Forgive me if I seem preoccupied. I am finding the business of running a city a bit overwhelming.
“Maybe I can help with that.”
I would welcome any help, my friend!
I was trained in weapons, tactics, and military strategy. But I’m afraid I have little experience with politics and governing.
“What if Queen Cleopatra returned?”
Oh gods! Such an event would be a blessing by Jupiter himself!
The wise queen of Egypt returned to her people. If only this fantasy could be made reality!

<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />Have you spoken with Evandrus? What did he say?<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" /> Do not spare my feelings. Well, maybe spare them<g id="g_litearmor_shrugbrief" /> just a little…
“Your return would be a godsend.”

<g id="g_litearmor_shocked" />Did he really say that? He always was such an idealistic young man.<g id="g_litearmor_headtilthmm" /> So much like his<g id="g_litearmor_handheart" /> father… His words touch me deeply.
<g id="g_male_spreadhands" />Please help Ghazi to decide how best to serve the people of Brimstone Sands.

<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" />I have considered what you and Imhotep have said. You<g id="g_litearmor_converseleft" /> both sacrificed so much for this land.<g id="g_litearmor_agree1" /> It is only fair that I do the same.
The Coronation
With Evandrus's support, Cleopatra has consented to retake her position of power. Inform all of New Corsica of her return, then attend her coronation at the Royal Pavilion.
“This won’t be an easy job.”
<g id="g_female_spreadarms" />It’s not the challenge that worries me. I’ve faced<g id="g_female_gestureleftm" /> many perils in the service of Imhotep, as you have seen.
<g id="g_litearmor_concerns" />I worry that I will fail my people. Again.
“Our past shouldn’t shackle us.”

<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" />You sound like Imhotep. He says<g id="g_litearmor_shrugbrief" /> our mistakes become wisdom and should strengthen us. Do you<g id="g_litearmor_converseright" /> think I’d be a good queen?
“You’d be a great queen.”
<g id="g_female_waveoffdisdain" />You’re just biased. I still want to know how the<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> people of New Corsica would feel about my return.
<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />Could you speak with the citizens and learn what’s in their hearts?<g id="g_female_youknows" /> When you’re done, meet us in the Royal Pavilion.
<g id="g_female_leanforwardsmall" />Have you spoken to the people? I<g id="g_litearmor_converseright" /> must know how they feel about my potential return.
The Queen has returned? This is a blessing from the gods themselves!
Queen Cleopatra would certainly liven things up. I wonder if that's a good thing…
Is this a jest? It isn't? Well, I suppose she couldn't possibly make things worse.
Queen Cleopatra and Evandrus ruling side by side? You’re describing a dream!
So, what did the people have to say?
“They’re all behind you, my Queen.”
Very well, then. I will accept this great honor from the people.
Thank you for being so stubborn-- uhm, I mean, for your guidance and wisdom.
"How do you feel, truly?"
I’m nervous, oddly enough. It’s been so long since I found myself in circumstances like these.
Facing hordes of Angry Earth seems easier at the moment. Please stay close by.
I still can’t believe Queen Cleopatra’s alive. The city rejoices at her return!
I wish my father could've been here to witness this moment.
This is a great day for Brimstone Sands, and you have made it possible. I am glad the gods led you here.
I am filled with joy! I never thought I’d live to see such a wondrous event. And it’s all thanks to you, my non-believer.
This is the dawning of a new day for our city and our people.
There will be great work ahead of us, but we are up to the challenge.
They said this was a land of miracles. I had begun to believe it was simply a land of nightmares.
I am glad to see that I was wrong.
I still can’t believe Queen Cleopatra’s alive. The city rejoices at her return!
I wish my father could've been here to witness this moment.
This is a great day for Brimstone Sands, and you have made it possible. I am glad the gods led you here.
We beseech Ra to witness this day! We call upon Cleopatra Thea Philopator, Daughter of Ptah, to be invested with the power to govern.
May she lead the people with wisdom and love. May her reign be a blessing to the land!
We beseech Ra to witness this day!
We call upon Cleopatra Thea Philopator, Daughter of Ptah...
To be invested with the power to govern.
May she lead the people with wisdom and love.
May her reign be a blessing to the land!
There is no doubt in my mind, you were sent by the gods. You are a hero out of myth.
You will forever have an ally and friend in me.
"What will you do now?"
I shall return to the library. There are still matters that require investigation.
As for you, be sure to celebrate this moment with appropriate wild abandon. If you overdo it, come see me for some herbal remedies.
Well, that’s done. Now the real work begins for us.
“Us?”
You didn’t think you were going to simply walk away into the sunset, did you?
You’re the Sword of Brimstone, remember? And I'm now the Queen of Brimstone.
“We should discuss compensation.”
Oh, I'm sure we can come to some mutually beneficial arrangment.
But for now, relax and enjoy yourself. You’ve certainly earned it.
Inform the citizens of New Corsica of Cleopatra's return
Rendezvous with Ghazi and Imhotep at the Royal Pavilion
Take your position for the Coronation to begin
Observe the Coronation of New Corsica's ruler
Mingle with the notables of New Corsica
What are you doing? Didn’t your Queen command that you relax and enjoy yourself?
Eat, drink, dance. There's more to life than fighting monsters.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & gives MSQ: The Wild Huntress
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_litearmor_converseright" />It is good to see hope restored to these sands, but I must confess that I am troubled by the reactivation of the Ennead.

string.comment: Default Dialogue & gives MSQ: The Wild Huntress
string.speaker: Imhotep
string.name: Imhotep

resources.string: <g id="g_female_explains" />Knowing that Artemis is involved and that she sought to raise Sutekh… it does not bode well.
The Wild Huntress

With the immediate threat stymied and Imhotep stabilized, he has recalled long forgotten memories about a shrine to Artemis somewhere in the northern reaches of Everfall. Visiting it may provide a clue to Adiana's - Artemis's - next move.
"She's planning something more."
<g id="g_female_nodding" />I fear that is what the signs do clearly portend. Though Artemis was known to take human form, her hatred for our species was legendary.
<g id="g_male_itsokay" />I am not surprised she invested much of her power in the Angry Earth, but where<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> that leads us, I am not sure.
"Would she have a home somewhere?"
<g id="g_female_nodconsider" />Hmm, the Ancients often had shrines they favored, where they received guests.
<g id="g_male_pointrealize" />I recall hearing her shrine featured a small fountain, or a well of some sort. It's likely long gone now.
"I met her at the Daughterwell."
<g id="g_male_nod2" />Yes! Yes, that's it! That's the name. Go to the Daughterwell. You must! There may be answers there.

<g id="g_female_leanforwardlisten" />But be careful, if the wrath of an Ancient has been stirred, I pray the<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> Light of Ra protects you.<g id="g_female_gestureleftm" /> Protects us all.
<g id="g_female_gesturerights" />Have you traveled to the Daughterwell? You may learn more of Artemis’s true intentions.
<g id="g_male_spreadarms001" />You’ve returned! I would guess a confrontation with Artemis did not occur then?
<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" />Did you learn anything more regarding her ambitions?
“She intends to end our immortality.”
<g id="g_male_shakehead" />Blessed Ra! An end to immortality is an end to humanity on Aeternum.<g id="g_female_youknows" /> It is a Great Purge after all, the final one.
“Can she really do that?”
<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" />Great Ptah, I hope not. But I intend to find out. This will require much research.
<g id="g_female_nodyes" />Our work continues, Sword of Brimstone. I fear we may eventually have to confront Artemis,<g id="g_female_explains" /> and we will need much help if we are to do that.
Return to the {POITags} and search for answers
Search the area for any hidden markers or shrines to Artemis
Cut down the overgrown vines
Investigate the Shrine of Artemis
Return to the Library in New Corsica to warn Imhotep
Your striking visage is always welcome, Sword of Brimstone. You make the days brighter, and the nights sweeter.
Where are you? You should have at least sent word by now…
<g id="female_gestureRightM" />I'm sorry, friend. Something important has my attention right now.<g id="female_shrugDontcare" /> Perhaps later?

string.comment: Brimstone Unlock bestowal: Strider in the Sands
string.speaker: Tomash Kovalenko
string.name: TomashKovalenko

resources.string: You've made it! Good!<g id="male_sighRelief" /> Your exploits precede you, and we have need of your aid.

string.comment: Brimstone Unlock bestowal: Strider in the Sands
string.speaker: Tomash Kovalenko
string.name: TomashKovalenko

resources.string: The Corrupted<g id="male_righthandAngry" /> Legion in Brimstone Sands is preparing an assault on the capital of New Corsica. The<g id="male_shakehead" /> civilians are fleeing the region in droves.
Strider of the Sands
Soulwarden Kovalenko has lost contact with an ally rendering aid to refugees.
"What can I do to help?"
Another Soulwarden,<g id="female_spreadarms" /> Buhawi, has been organizing the refugees, helping in any way he can.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> I haven't heard from him for some time.
"How can I get past it?"
From a tidbit of Yonas's knowledge, we were able to reconstruct the formula for the needed cerate. I believe... yes, this is the list of supplies he needed.
Brew and apply the Desert Cerate, and it will allow you to walk the sands unscathed. Then please, find Buhawi.
My good friend Buhawi is attempting to help the people of Brimstone Sands.
Ho there! Is that a fellow Soulwarden I see?
I hope<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" /> this means the residents of this place will get the assistance they need. I've done what I can, but it is far from enough.
"What can I do?"

I suggest you speak to the others in this camp, especially that young woman over<g id="female_pointLeft" /> there. She has been responsible for organizing much of this, and can explain the current situation.
Thank you<g id="male_bowShallowPerfunctory" /> again, comrade. You have brought hope where there was none.
Find the ingredients for the Desert Cerate
Gather {itemName} from eastern Shattered Mountain
Gather {itemName} from central Great Cleave
Gather {itemName} from central Ebonscale Reach
Collect Fish Oil from Salvaging Fish or at the Trading Post
Mix the Desert Cerate at an Arcane Repository or Campsite
Apply the Desert Cerate to protect against the weather of Brimstone Sands
Journey to Ebonscale Reach and approach the gate to Brimstone Sands
Enter Brimstone Sands and begin the search for Soulwarden Buhawi
Cross the Deadwater Wastes
Search for Soulwarden Buhawi in {POITags}
You smell like dust and heat, friend! I assume you made it into the deserts of Brimstone Sands without too much difficulty. And Buhawi?
<g id="male_nodMild" />You've taken a weight off my shoulders! Thank<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" /> you for checking up on him.

<g id="male_spreadhands" />Tomash is a bit overprotective at times.<g id="female_shrugDontcare" /> Just means he cares. But helping people is what I'm meant to do,<g id="female_smackfist" /> no matter the danger.
<g id="male_handshipsdisapprove" />Corruption, Lost, an Ancient device… doesn't matter. I am a warrior, a defender, and I will stand between the darkness and the light!
Tomash is a bit overprotective at times. Just means he cares. But helping people is what I'm meant to do, no matter the danger. Corruption, Lost, an Ancient device… doesn't matter.
I am a warrior, a defender, and I will stand between the darkness and the light!
It seems our work is never done. I've received word from a trusted ally named Lysandra.
She's been hearing rumors of strange tremors in the desert.
Tremors in the Sand
One of Imhotep's allies, Lysandra, has sent warning of strange events in the sands. Imhotep has asked you to seek her out and assist her in determining their cause.
"Apophis?"
By Ra's Light, let's hope not! I was hoping you could investigate.
It's impossible to know exactly what Artemis set into motion with her actions at the pyramid. This could be related.
"There are worse things out there?"
The Ancients spawned all manner of terrible things in aeons past.
When I first arrived, there were already legends of monstrous beings that once threatened the very existence of Aeternum.
"Well that's good news."
Go and speak to Lysandra. See what she knows.
If this is another one of Artemis's weapons, it's best we know it and find a way to counter it.
<g id="g_female_youknow" />Have you spoken to Lysandra about those strange tremors in the desert?<g id="g_female_tiltheadremember" /> We need to know what is causing them.
You found spines? Good gods... I will study these and see what I can glean.
"Do the legends mention this?"
There were stories of colossal elder things that gnawed at the roots of the island. I had believed them to simply be stories.
"This place never ceases to amaze me."
It does seem to be the source of endless horrors, doesn't it? Thank the gods we have heroes like you.
Aid Lysandra in her investigation of the tremors
Keep your senses honed, my friend.
I may need to travel to other parts of Aeternum to gather more knowledge. We stand at the dawn of a new age…
Brimstone Sands has been my home for centuries.
I refuse to leave with nothing to remember the place where I finally found love and happiness.
I tried to leave, I really did. I had every intention! When I reached this camp, my heart demanded I stop.
Here in this desert, I found everything I wanted in life, and I cannot leave empty-handed.
Flower of the Sands
Collect Cactus Flowers in memory of Zahur's husband and bring them to him in the Camp.
"What is it you can't leave behind?"
The memories... of my love. Titus and I were friends for decades, but then it blossomed into something more.
He brought me flowers from the desert one day… a day I'll never forget. Now he's fallen to the Legion.
"I’ll collect flowers in his memory."
You… would do that for me? If I just had some cactus flowers I could preserve, I could keep my memories of Titus and what we had.
Yes, please. If you'll collect flowers from the cacti, I would be most grateful.
Collect {itemName} from Cacti in Brimstone Sands
My sweet Titus. I will not leave with nothing to remember him by.
Ah, you found them. Just as bright and beautiful as the day my Titus came in from the sands.
Now I can leave and seek sanctuary in Oxboro. I could never repay your kindness, but take this as some small compensation.
I feel more optimistic about my journey now, free to remember the love I had… but still able to move forward.
These sands, they move… in a most unnatural way. Do you see? There! They quiver with energy. Dark days are coming…
Careful for your step, traveler. The sands, they come alive! The earth strikes back with angry vengeance!
I wrote the scrolls, in my own hand, but even I had come to doubt such horrors ever existed… until now.
Sand Walkers
Defeat the Sand Walkers in The Acropolis for Tahirah.
"What changed?"
The sands…. they come to life and walk on two feet! Just like you and me! It is most unnatural!
And if history is a lesson, these Sand Walkers tread the path of doom for us! As it was many centuries in the past.
"Can we fight them?"
We must destroy the seed from which they spring, but until then, we can strike the Walkers down where we find them.
Venture into the Acropolis, brave one, and banish the Walkers back to the sands.
These Sand Walkers… they mean to replace us. I swear it. You must strike them down!
Enter the grounds of {POITags} and destroy the Sand Walkers
Seach for and destroy Sand Walkers
Destroy {targetName}
You have returned the Walkers to the sands! Heroes like you saved us once before.
Go now, seek out more of the Sand Walkers and destroy them… before they destroy us.
You may be the only hope this desert has.
The 19th Legion should be remembered with honor, with reverence, not with terror and disgust.
Know this, friend. The 19th Legion was not always dedicated to darkness. It was once the most valiant legion in all of Rome.
The 19th stayed loyal to Mark Antony even as Alexandria fell. They escorted Antony and the Queen here…
Honoring the 19th
Confiscate Pickaxes from the Corrupted 19th, and recover their Legion Insignias for Acario Clemon.
"What happened?"
It is a dark tale I do not care to dwell upon. In recent years, some of us have taken up the banner to restore the Legion's honor.
This blasphemous statue the Corrupted Legion is constructing to honor their leader, General Crassus, is a major setback
"We should stop them."
Aha, I knew you had honor the moment I saw you! Indeed, if you're venturing into the fort, it can be done.
Confiscate the pickaxes to stop them from mining, and if you find any old Legion insignias, I'll reward you for them. Godspeed!
We will restore honor to the crest of the 19th Legion, no matter how long it takes.
Assault Crassus's Rise and Avenge the Honor of the 19th Legion
Defeat {targetName} to Collect {itemName}
Confiscate {itemName} from {targetName} to stop the Monument to General Crassus
I heard the clamor. It sounded like you dealt those villains a blow that'll shut them down! Well done!
And you managed to recover some of the old insignias, as well! You are an ally if ever there was one!
"What else can we do?"
Ah. Not much more can be done here, but there are other allies in the region.
Look for Tribune Alaina Kraus during your travels, I suspect she needs support as well. Invictus Aeterna, my friend!
Progress on that damned statue has really been set back after your assault. Well done, friend!
Believe it or not, our people once thought it was from this Temple that the sun was set afire each day.
Behold the glorious Lamp of Osiris, wayfarer! This sacred temple was once believed to be where the gods set the sun afire each day.
The fallacy of our faith was exposed centuries ago, but the Temple should still be ours.
On Duty, the Sun Never Sets

Once Priestess of the Lamp of Osiris, Qabalah asks you to destroy the Ancient Guardians that contol the temple and retrieve the sacred Spark of Osiris from the Lamplighter. The Lamplighter ascends the ruins at day, but descends into a hidden chamber at night.
"If not yours, who controls it?"
The Ancient Anubians, servant-constructs to the Ancients themselves. They prevent humans from trespassing.
But it was we who helped build the temple, and though it is not divine, the Spark of Osiris belongs to us.
"Should I reclaim the artifact?"
Ah, so you aspire to walk in the steps of the heroes of old? I welcome your aid, then.
Strike down the Anubians, and recover the sacred Spark of Osiris from the Lamplighter who ascends the ruins by day and goes below at night.
The Lamplighter appears above at day, but cycles into the bowels of the temple at night. There is a way, but it is not easily seen.
Enter the {POITags} and Destroy the Ancient Anubians
Destroy Ancient Anubians
Search for and Defeat {targetName} to reclaim the sacred {itemName}
I have not seen anyone challenge the Anubians as you have in many a moon. Indeed, the spirit of the heroes of old lives on in you.
You have restored the Spark to humanity, where it belongs. Thank you.
It is a tragedy we were blocked from so many of the sacred temples we once helped to build.
But you retrived the Spark of Osiris, and that is something indeed.
If you're headed towards Jupiter's Grove, beware. The dangers of the grove have multiplied in a matter of weeks.
Elementals now haunt the place, and they are vengeful towards humanity.
Oh, you there. Are you by chance headed into Jupiter's Grove? Are you aware of what's befallen that site?
The Grove is now overrun with Elemental entities, and I cannot get by them.
The Secret of the Baths
Thermae Alchemist Clarisse Vesta has asked you to collect Embalming Sands from the sarcophagi in Jupiter's Grove for the Roman baths in New Corsica. Deliver them to Host Habibah in the city.
"Is there anything I can help with?"
Perhaps, if you have the capacity to exercise a certain level of discretion.
This relates to the secret recipe we use to sweeten the Roman Baths in New Corsica. You have to swear to secrecy.
"Alright. I swear."
Excellent! We need Embalming Sands from the sarcophagi in the Grove.
I know what you're thinking, but it is great for the skin. And you swore! So, get the sands, and bring the "delivery" to Host Habibah in New Corsica.
The thermae in New Corsica will soon turn foul without these sands. Please hurry!
Search {POITags} for Sands to add to the Baths in New Corsica
Search Sarcophagi and Chests in {POITags} to Collect {itemName}
Welcome to the Thermae of New Corsica, traveler, the finest in all Aeternum.
I regret to say, however, that the baths are not suitable for soaking today.
"I have a delivery from the Grove."
Oh, then my great shame is finally to be relieved! Yes, I will take… these. Thank you very much.
I would ask you to simply forget from whence these came. In exchange, a modest reward. And free soaking, for life!
Thank you for the delivery… and your discretion. For you, the baths are complimentary!
Habibah sent word that the waters of the thermae once again restore the health of all guests to New Corsica.
Thank you for your help. And of course for your utmost discretion on this matter.
I am here on official Marauder business. I have no time to trifle with you. Why don't you come back when you've got some guts!
Well met, fellow Marauder! What trophies have you taken lately?
Pah, you're in the wrong place. Go beg the gods for help, or whatever it is you do.
Walk back the way you came. Unless you're looking for a good fight…
Ah, the sight of you warms this old warrior's heart. Keep winning glory, for mighty Mars and the Marauders!
Begone! I have time only for those who crave knowledge. The Syndicate keeps to our own.
Ah, excuse me, I was lost in thought. How might the Syndicate serve you?
Spare me your misguided idealism. My time is too valuable to waste with you.
You're looking for Commander Maximo, Marauder. My words would be meaningless to you.
If only there were more members of the Syndicate like you. Think of all we could achieve, the vast ambitions we could realize…
Hmm… Those who are truly blind cannot see even in the light.
Once you have taken the scales from your eyes and sided with the Covenant, then we may do business.
If you always give, you will always have. What may I give you, devotee?
Those who live by the sword will perish by it. Be on your way, Marauder.
Are you here to make amends for your hubris? Let me know if you change your mind.
You are a beacon of hope and life in these trying times. Every deed, from the humble to the great, kindles the light in all of us.
You would be an excellent candidate for the Marauders. If you wish to join our battles, I welcome you with open arms.
We never run out of foes to fight and victories to win. This vicious island suits us Marauders.
You'll want Adjudicator Teos, not me. I never was much of an orator.
Talk to Alchemist Euphrosyne if you must. I never have any idea what you Syndicate are talking about.
There are no pretenses among us Marauders. You're here for gold, battle, and glory, and I have opportunites aplenty.
Others see eternal life as a curse, but not the seekers of the Syndicate.
Endless years to learn, understand, and plumb the mysteries of the world. What could be better?
Welcome, welcome. There are enough mysteries in this land to keep both of us occupied.
We're not so different, you and I. All you need is a little more curiosity about the light you so fervently safeguard.
Don't you ever wonder if there's more to life than battle and bloodshed? If so, you know where to find me.
Someday, we'll rival the works of the Ancients themselves. We will be the architects of our own paradise, right here on Aeternum.
Are you lost, friend? We all are, in one way or another.
But some of us choose to join the Covenant and find our way through the darkness, together.
We sing the song of hope on an island of strife.
I know it seems a thankless task at times, but you are never alone. The light of others shines with you.
A Marauder? If you're here to pick a fight, I must decline. This is not the time or place.
For those who claim to know so much, you Syndicate understand little. Farewell.
It's easy to give in to one's base impulses. Violence, greed, naked ambition.
But you rise above such things. You are an inspiration to us all.
You're strong, traveler, but you'd be stronger with Marauders at your side. Come on, I promise we don't bite. Much.
I've heard the wildest tales about your battles, friend. If even half are true, you could cross blades with the legends of old!
You here for a drink? How about a fight? Tch, you Covenant are all work and no play.
Hello. How's your disturbing research going? What? That's what the Syndicate does, right?
Having you around has really livened this place up. I hope you stay a while, friend. Our victories will be the stuff of legend!
Return when you are ready to be inducted in the arcane mysteries of the Syndicate. Until then, we have nothing to discuss.
With each new discovery, our understanding deepens, and our power grows. The quest never ends, fellow seeker.
Open your mind to the infinite possibilities of the cosmos. Perhaps then, we can talk.
We have nothing for you, Marauder. Seek your simple pleasures elsewhere.
The day is coming, fellow seeker. That sublime dawn when knowledge sets us free, and mankind breaks all its shackles.
No one, no matter how strong, should be without allies. Remember that, traveler.
Welcome home, friend. The divine calls to us with many different voices, but we of the Covenant answer as one.
Valor is nothing without a higher purpose.
Wisdom comes with compassion, not ambitious grasping.
Aeternum is a land in desperate need of hope, love, and protection. We provide it through our service. Never doubt that, friend.
Salvage curatives from the legendary scorpions of {POITags}
Anecdotal Antidote (Elite)
Clear the white wolves from the aqueduct at {POITags}. Mission can only be completed at night
Nightmare in White
Hunt the vicious lions of {POITags}.
Regicide
Eliminate a trio of powerful idols from Atum's Way.
Sacred Stone
Take down the Legion's dangerous hounds at {POITags}.
Beasts of Blood
Lead an assault against Castrum Stativa.
Censure the Wicked (Elite)
Eliminate the skeletal minions at the Heron Excavation.
Righteous Revenge
Defeat the wretched Lost bandits at {POITags}.
A Blight on the Land
Purify the poisonous waters of the Great Bazaar.
Dead and Unburied
Visit {POITags} and put the glory of the ancients in the hands of the people.
Glory of the Past
Collect the keys to unlock a hidden treasure at {POITags}.
Key to the Past
Secure enemy armaments from {POITags}.
Swords to Plowshares
Put the Legion in their place at {POITags}.
Necessary Evil
Punish the Legion at {POITags} for their pillaging.
Might and Right
Secure the fortress tools of the Legion at {POITags} for Corsica.
In The Wrong Hands
Retrieve the components of the Legion's armaments at {POITags}.
Swift as an Arrow
Secure goods that can aid the people at {POITags}.
For the Greater Good
Find ancient items in {POITags} that might serve the common good.
Those Who Came Before
Solve what the ancients have left behind at {POITags}.
A Grand Experiment
Put the angry souls of {POITags} to rest.
Purification
Calm the wretched spectres {POITags}.
Laid to Rest
Quell the dark power of {POITags}.
Brought to Justice
Investigate the tombs of ancient nobles at {POITags}.
Hallowed be Thy Name
Destroy the banners of the Legion from {POITags}.
Permit No Evil
Give the unquiet Lost of {POITags} an honorable end.
Pity the Lost
Hunt Brimstone Sands' legendary scorpions at {POITags}.
Handle with Caution (Elite)
Clear the nocturnal wolves from {POITags}. Mission can only be completed at night
Predatory Instincts
Hunt the vicious lions of {POITags}.
King of the Jungle
Eliminate a trio of powerful idols from Atum's Way.
Idolatry
Take down the Legion's dangerous hounds in {POITags}.
Hounds of Hell
Lead an assault against Castrum Stativa.
Cleave the Corrupt (Elite)
Eliminate the skeletal minions at the Heron Excavation.
Justice for the Dead
Take care of the Lost bandits that prey on travellers at {POITags}.
No Rest for the Wicked
Purify the poisonous waters of the Great Bazaar.
Dead on Arrival
Seize the spectacular riches of the Ancients from {POITags}.
Ancient Splendor
Collect the keys to unlock a hidden treasure at {POITags}.
Skeleton Keys
Secure enemy armaments from {POITags}.
Loot and Plunder
Hit the Legion where it'll hurt most at {POITags}.
Undermining
The Legion's spoils of war are yours to claim from {POITags}.
To the Victor
Filch the tools of the Legion's fortresses at {POITags}.
Deconstruction Site
The Legion has incredible archers at {POITags}. Steal their kit.
Enemy Appropriation
These luxurious prizes of {POITags} are yours to claim.
Trophy Hunter
What good is the treasure of {POITags} if left buried in the dust?
Treasure Hunt
An ancient site; a hidden prize. {POITags} is yours for the taking.
Rites and Rituals
There's got to be something valuable in {POITags}.
All That Glitters
These ghastly Lost are hiding riches in their town of {POITags}.
Bitter Pill

Honor's End
A Roman is searching for memoriabelia of his departed friends.
If you value your sanity, leave this place. There is no knowledge or power inside, only madness.
Tread carefully, friend. There is naught but despair within these walls. You shall find no redemption here…
"What do you mean?"
I was once courier to the lord Crassus and his legion. He dispatched me to seek reinforcements during his battle to secure this once-sacred place.
"Sounds like an important job."
But I was careless in my haste and was struck down on the road. When I returned, my former comrades were stone, and the legion defeated.
"They have awakened now."
Yes. But they serve a strange new master now. I cannot abide such evil. My honor is lost to me. I wish only to give their loved ones some closure.
"Then what are you doing here?"
Before the ages took us, each legionary wore a lead coin inscribed with their family name worn as a necklace.
“How can I help?”
If you find any legionaries that still bear this insignia, bring them to me, and I will inform their families.
I implore you, stranger… help me perform this last act of service.
My thanks, friend. Over time, hope rots and poisons the heart. At least this way, the loved ones of our fallen can have closure.
It’s grim, but knowing that those they cherished will never return may set them free to find a new path forward. Forever is a terribly long time to mourn.
Collect coins from corrupted Romans
I am grateful for you help, friend. I will return these coins to their families. Afterwards I may yet have further need of you.
New Corsica welcomes you, traveler. I am Prefect Barnabas Severan. I must apologize for the state of our city but we live in troubled times.
